story:
We create versatile gear that lasts and goes with you everywhere, everyday, on every adventure. Designing with colors that don’t look like you came from a glow stick party, we provide styles you can wear from the trail to dinner with friends. Fibre implements high standards of design in every detail to establish superior quality and durability in the products we offer you.  We believe you shouldn't have to sacrifice style and performance to own sustainably produced items. Our materials are ethically sourced and our clothing is crafted from 100% organic and recycled fabrics. We produce in the U.S.A. ensuring employees earn livable wages in safe working conditions.  Fibre Athletics is deeply committed to the health of our communities and surroundings so each purchase you make supports environmental restoration and poverty alleviation projects around the world.

We have accomplished so much in the last six months with the help of our amazing friends, family, vendors, and many others supporting us on this journey. Now we turn to you, the IndieGoGo community!

Small quantities of our gear are currently being made in Chicago, however, in order for us to get these products to more of you and fully launch our company, we need your help. Our goal is to raise $50,000 in order to go into full-production of our Everywhere Fleece Jacket and Pursuit Top.

Here are the perks you will receive with each pledge:


To see all colors and styles, please visit click here to visit the gallery page.

If you are interested in ordering 3 or more of any particular perk, please contact us.

May 28th, 2016
6am - 12pm

Join us for an intense and fun morning workout and fitness competition along the shores of Lake Michigan in Chicago led by personal trainer Andrew Leonard and his team.  We’ll gather for a pre-dawn run and engage in a series of team based fitness challenges as the sun peaks over the Lake.  Meet new people, test your endurance, and compete against other teams doing shuttle runs, medicine ball slams, battle ropes, plank contests, band sprints and wheel barrels.  Cap off the morning with a session of yoga and after a quick shower, enjoy a delicious, locally sourced brunch with your team.  Accomplish more by 11:30 AM than most people do all weekend! 

Prizes
1 Month of Nutritional Coaching
(or 4 sessions, so 1 session per person if teams of 4),
FA Logo T-Shirt and Water Bottle


February 7th, 2016 - February 13th, 2016

  • Day 1 (2/7/16): Arrival

  • Guests arrive at Kahului Airport (OGG) and are transported to the Kula Lodge
  • Meals will not be provided on travel days
  • Certified Trail & Safety Guide will be attending all hikes

  • Day 2 (2/8/16): Hōlua Cabin

  • Group breakfast, pack supplies & lunch, drive up 10,000 feet to the cloud line and begin hike to Holua Cabin
  • Orientation at Haleakalā National Park & Volcano Visitor Center, hike 7.5 miles
  • Arrive at Cabin, explore terrain, group dinner

    Day 3 (2/9/16): Hike to Kapalaoa Cabin
  • Hike 3.5 miles down the Halemauʻu Trail to Kapalaoa Cabin which lies at the bottom of the cliffs on the south side of the valley
  • Sunset dinner at the base of the crater

    Day 4 (2/10/16): Hike to Palikū Cabin
  • Settle in at cabin, optional hike to waterfall in the nearby rain forest cliff
  • All meals provided

    Day 5 (2/11/16): Hike Out of Crater, Drive to Beach
  • Early breakfast and 10.5 mile hike from back wall of crater to it's top
  • Trip from Haleakala to Beachfront Housing on West side of Maui Beach
  • Cookout

    Day 6 (2/12/16): Beach Party, Water Sports, Whales!
  • Day of snorkeling, relaxing, paddle boarding, and whale watching in kayaks
  • Sunset luau, cookout, and bonfire

    Day 7 (2/13/16): Departure
  • Breakfast, last swim, transportation to the airport to depart


April 23rd to April 30th, 2016

  • Day 1 (4/23/16): Arrival & Antigua - Hotel Las Camelias

  • Flights into Guatemala City, transport to Antigua (one hour)

    Day 2 (4/24/16): Antigua  - Hotel Les Camelias
  • Morning: City tour, service/cultural perspective
  • Afternoon:
    Option 1 - Walk through the city - Exploration of the local market
    Option 2 - Pacaya Volcano Hike - Guided Hike by local outfitter, Erik
    Option 3 - Coffee Plantation Tour - Filadelfia Coffee Finca
  • Evening: Dinner (Saberico) and background talk with Erik

    Day 3 (4/25/15): Antigua to Xela - Hotel Modelo
  • Transport from Antigua to Xela (Quetzaltenango), (approximately 3 hours)
  • Wander Xela - Independent adventure

    Day 4 (4/26/16): Begin Trek 
  • Hiking, Camping

    Day 5 (4/27/16): On the Trail 
  • Hiking, Camping

    Day 6 (4/28/16): Lago de Atitlan - Hotel Posada de Santiago
  • Half day to complete hike
  • Lunch in San Pedro La Laguna
  • Transport from San Pedro to Santiago
  • Explore Santiago

    Day 7: (4/29/16) Lago de Atitlan - Hotel Posada de Santiago
  • Daytime:
    Option 1 - Horseback riding (setup through hotel)
    Option 2 - Yoga at the lake (instructor led)
    Option 3 - Self-exploration into Santiago, or nearby lake town
  • Evening: Group Dinner

    Day 8: (4/30/16): Departure
  • Transfer from hotel to airport (approx 3 hours)
  • Book hotel transfers with Posada de Santiago

Fibre Athletics is for you, the adventures you dream about, and the ones you live everyday. We support your exploration of various terrains, athletic pursuits, and your here and now. You strive to live authentically and we make gear to reflect your lifestyle. Our products are stylish, attuned to quality details, and designed to go everywhere you go.


Fibre Athletics Prepares You For a Lifetime of Adventure


We are a Chicago Fair Trade Certified Company sourcing organic and recycled materials from ethical companies, using organic and recycled fabrics, sourcing or custom-making trims in the US, and producing locally. 


Wearing Fibre Athletics Creates Positive Impact in These Ways: 

  • Improve Environmental Sustainability:

    By supporting certified organic farms effectively practicing rational crop planting and prohibiting pesticides, you're helping save thousands of gallons of water per year and reducing chemical run-off in rivers. By profiting forward-thinking, community-minded mills and manufacturers who abide to Global Organic Textile Standars and Oeko-Tex 100 certification systems and push greener textile innovation you are moving production towards a thriving, positive future.

  • Enable Ethical Production and Positive Workplaces:


    By supporting mills and factories who establish safe working conditions for their employees, do not force workers into sex-trafficking, certify their team members are not near hazardous chemicals, do not overwork craftspeople, treat staff with respect, and pay employees livable wages, you are creating healthy livelihoods and mental well-being in our communities.

  • Reforest and Rebuild a Stronger Working Community Worldwide :

    Fibre Athletics supports environmental restoration and poverty alleviation groups around the world.  Your purchase helps us fund our inaugural Impact Partners: Eden Reforestation Project and The Cara Program.  Our work with Eden restores degraded land and creates sorely needed jobs in local communities in Ethiopia, Madagascar, Haiti and Nepal. Collaborating with The Cara Program prepares and inspires over 700 motivated individuals to break the cycle of homelessness and poverty, transform lives, and strengthen our current population.


Steve Sullivan (CEO/Founder): Over 20 years of service management and non-profit leadership experience helping launch and rejuvenate two multi-million dollar non-profits in Chicago (The Cara Program and Public Allies).

Sadie Monroe (Creative Director/Partner): Artist and designer based in Chicago. In addition to her independent practice, Monroe co-founded co.lab in 2012, an experimental art and design platform focusing on collaboration. 

We have worked closely with our product developer and our vendors, completing several rounds of prototypes to test fit, comfort, and durability in the designs. In addition, we are manufacturing locally enabling us to oversee quality in our products and address unforeseen challenges promptly.

Our first round of signature items are ready to begin production so the first backers of our Pursuit Top and Everywhere Jacket will be will be shipped their goods in a timely manner. Once we have sold through those items currently in production, we will need to place a new order to fulfill your perk purchase.  We have done our best to have backup materials lined up to cut and sew your clothing as quickly as possible and ship your order.

There are many ways you can help with our campaign! Any pledge is greatly appreciated, but we also encourage you to help us spread the word about our campaign to as many people as possible! Share our link by email, on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. 

Beyond our campaign, please consider supporting the hard working businesses and organizations keeping manufacturing in the USA. They sacrifice additional profit in order to create and keep jobs in the US.  Many of these same companies look to Recycle and use Organic materials to manufacture their goods, benefitting all of us now and later.

                 Support Sustainable, Ethically Crafted, and Made in USA products.
Tell Me More about the Materials and Their Production :

The Everywhere Fleece Jacket is made from 100% organic cotton from Texas and our Pursuit Top is 100% recycled polyester (from recycled water bottles) coming from Taiwan and OEKO-TEX 100 certified (a respected and stringent environmental certification system in the textile industry).  Both products are cut and sewn in Chicago, IL.

Our Fibre Tee is made 60% Hemp and 40% organic cotton and manufactured in New York.  The raw materials are ethically sourced from the US, China & Indonesia. 

The Fibre Cap is made from 65% recycled polyester and 35% organic cotton. It is manufactured in New Jersey with materials sourced from India which are GOTS certified (The Global Organic Textile Standard : worldwide leading textile processing standard for organic fibres).

The Water Bottle is 90% Recycled Aluminum and made by US Veterans in Zero Waste factory in Washington. 

The Fibre Ragg Wool Hat is  50% organic wool and 50% eco-polyester made from recycled soda bottles sourced in the US and manufactured in New Jersey.

What are the work conditions and wages like for the people making these products?

Fibre Athletics is a Chicago Fair Trade company and our vendors provide safe working conditions and livable wages throughout our supply chain.  

Contour Fit (Women) :

  • Flatters your natural shape to comfortably and stably cover your body         while active

  • Achieves the perfect balance of fit; avoiding skin-tight spandex and boxy, ill-fitting tops

Athletic Fit (Men) :

  • Comfortable, yet slim fit complimenting your natural, yet healthy build

  • Achieves the balance of fit; avoiding skin-tight spandex and boxy, ill-fitting t-shirts

Zipper Pockets and Concealed Pockets :

  • Securely store items most important to you when traveling or on the go:

    • Phone, ID, Keys, Passport, Chapstick, Money or CC, MP3 player

2 Piece Collar and Hood :

  • Hood and Collar are two different pieces

  • Hood is sewn to the back neckline and snaps to the collar

    • Wear the hood down and unsnapped, down and snapped, up and snapped

    • Hood stays out of your way when not needed

  • The high-standing collar keeps your neck warm by itself

    • Collar can be folded down when not in use

Lined Hood :

  • Adds coziness and extra warmth

Custom Reverse Coil Zippers :

  • Made specifically for Fibre Athletics jackets to be stronger, look better, and provide more comfort than traditional zippers

Reinforced Elbows :

  • Second layer of fabric added to minimize stretch, sagging, thinning of fabric at high stress point in your jacket

Back Dropped Curved Hemline :

  • Provides ideal coverage in back when you’re wearing yoga pants, compression tights, or performing overhead arm movements

  • Adds warmth your body in cold weather

Flat Felled Seams :

  • Encase all raw edges to avoid unraveling of stitching and keep seams flat

  • Increase durability and longevity of your jacket

  • Increase comfort, minimizing chafing while you’re wearing the jacket

Twill Tape :

  • Flat twill-woven ribbon of cotton sewn in along the center front zipper and neckline of your jacket

  • Stabilize seams where they tend to stretch over time and use

Bar Tacks :

  • Reinforcement stitching at pocket edges to keep pockets ripping from jacket after multiple uses

Shoulder Panels :

  • Increase your comfort during a range of arm movements

  • Follow the natural slope of the your shoulders for a better fit

2 Piece Raglan Sleeve :

  • A style of sleeve making your shirt very easy and comfortable to move around in when active

  • No Shoulder Seams

Side Panels :

  • Along side torso; create a flattering, form-fit without the top feeling too snug on your body

Curved Hem :

  • Flatters your shape while providing increased coverage when active

  • Doesn’t interfere with your leg movement when physically engaged

Flat Lock Seams :

  • Strong seams increasing durability and longevity of your shirt

  • Increase comfort by getting rid of bulky seam edges and reducing chafing

Chitosante :

  • All Natural, Environmentally Friendly Bio-Agent added to your Pursuit Top

  • Strongly inhibits the growth of bacteria so your shirt stays fresh, hygienic, odor resistant, soft, absorbent, durable, fast drying, static free, wrinkle resistant, breathable, and pill resistant

  • The only anti-bacterial bio-agent in the world that is certified by the US Environmental Protection Agency

Everywhere Jacket Fabric:

  • Certified Organic Cotton Fleece (10oz weight)

  • Milled and Spun in North Carolina by Spiritex Fabrics (Asheville, NC)

  • Tumble dried to ensure maximum softness and minimal shrinkage

  • Low-impact fibre reactive dye process meeting GOTS (Global Organic Textile Standards)

    • 80% less waste water runoff than average synthetic dye process

    • Bright, Rich, excellent colorfast properties that won’t fade

  • Organically grown cotton in Texas (Texas Organic Growers Marketing Coop)


Pursuit Top Fabric:

  • Custom Lightweight, Breathable Recycled Polyester made from Recycled Water Bottles

  • Made with Chitosante (derived from Chitosan)

    • Environmentally friendly/all natural treatment

    • The only anti-bacterial bio-agent in the world that is certified by the US Environmental Protection Agency

    • Uses biomass made from crab and/or shrimp shells

    • Strongly inhibits the growth of bacteria

    • Fabric stays fresh, hygienic, and odor resistant

    • Soft, absorbent, durable, fast drying, static free, wrinkle resistant, breathable, pill resistant, good drapability, easy to handle, biodegradable

  • Colors achieved using low impact dying process

  • Fabric custom made by Kendor Textiles:

    • Specialize in PET yarns, eco-friendly fibres, sustainable growth, and organics

    • Their growth is built on quality service, personal relationships, and integrity

    • They source from Taiwan, China, Australia and Europe ensuring their mills are in safe conditions, pay employees livable working wages and treat them with respect

  • Oeko-Tex Standard 100 Certified Fabric:

    • Independent testing and certification system for textile raw materials, intermediate and end products at all stages of production

    • Tests for harmful and illegal substances, legally regulated substances, known harmful chemicals, parameters for health care




ALL TRIMS FOR PURSUIT TOP & EVERYWHERE JACKET SOURCED AND MADE IN USA:

Zippers : Ucan Zippers, Vernon, California

Snaps : YKK USA, Lawrenceburg, Kentucky

Cotton Twill Tape & Brand Labels : Wayne Mills, Philadelphia, PA

Size Tags / Care Labels : Leader Thread, NY

Cut & Sew Factory, Gil Sewing Corp, Chicago IL

Packaging : Eco-enclose, Longmont CO
story_txt:
We create versatile gear that lasts and goes with you everywhere, everyday, on every adventure. Designing with colors that don’t look like you came from a glow stick party, we provide styles you can wear from the trail to dinner with friends. Fibre implements high standards of design in every detail to establish superior quality and durability in the products we offer you.  We believe you shouldn't have to sacrifice style and performance to own sustainably produced items. Our materials are ethically sourced and our clothing is crafted from 100% organic and recycled fabrics.  We produce in the U.S.A. ensuring employees earn livable wages in safe working conditions.  Fibre Athletics is deeply committed to the health of our communities and surroundings so each purchase you make supports environmental restoration and poverty alleviation projects around the world.



We have accomplished so much in the last six months with the help of our amazing friends, family, vendors, and many others supporting us on this journey.  Now we turn to you, the IndieGoGo community!Small quantities of our gear are currently being made in Chicago, however, in order for us to get these products to more of you and fully launch our company, we need your help.  Our goal is to raise $50,000 in order to go into full-production of our Everywhere Fleece Jacket and Pursuit Top.Here are the perks you will receive with each pledge:



To see all colors and styles, please visit click here to visit the gallery page.


If you are interested in ordering 3 or more of any particular perk, please contact us.

May 28th, 20166am - 12pm
Join us for an intense and fun morning workout and fitness competition along the shores of Lake Michigan in Chicago led by personal trainer Andrew Leonard and his team.  We’ll gather for a pre-dawn run and engage in a series of team based fitness challenges as the sun peaks over the Lake.  Meet new people, test your endurance, and compete against other teams doing shuttle runs, medicine ball slams, battle ropes, plank contests, band sprints and wheel barrels.  Cap off the morning with a session of yoga and after a quick shower, enjoy a delicious, locally sourced brunch with your team.  Accomplish more by 11:30 AM than most people do all weekend! 
Prizes1 Month of Nutritional Coaching(or 4 sessions, so 1 session per person if teams of 4),FA Logo T-Shirt and Water Bottle




February 7th, 2016 - February 13th, 2016

Guests arrive at Kahului Airport (OGG) and are
     transported to the Kula Lodge
Meals will not be provided on travel
     days

Certified Trail & Safety Guide will be
     attending all hikes

Group

Orientation

Hike 3.5 miles down the Halemauʻu Trail to Kapalaoa

Sunset

     cliff

Early breakfast and 10.5 mile hike from back wall
     of crater to it's top
Trip from Haleakala to Beachfront Housing on West

Sunset luau, cookout, and bonfire

Breakfast,

Fibre Athletics is for you, the adventures you dream about, and the ones you live everyday. We support your exploration of various terrains, athletic pursuits, and your here and now. You strive to live authentically and we make gear to reflect your lifestyle. Our products are stylish, attuned to quality details, and designed to go everywhere you go.




Fibre Athletics Prepares You For a Lifetime of Adventure





We are a Chicago Fair Trade Certified Company sourcing organic and recycled materials from ethical companies, using organic and recycled fabrics, sourcing or custom-making trims in the US, and producing locally. Wearing Fibre Athletics Creates Positive Impact in These Ways: 

Improve Environmental Sustainability:
By supporting certified
organic farms effectively practicing rational crop planting and prohibiting
pesticides, you're helping save thousands of gallons of water per year and
reducing chemical run-off in rivers. By profiting forward-thinking,
community-minded mills and manufacturers who abide to Global Organic Textile
Standars and Oeko-Tex 100 certification systems and push greener textile
innovation you are moving production towards a thriving, positive future.


Enable Ethical Production and Positive
Workplaces:

By supporting mills and factories who establish safe working conditions for their employees, do not
force workers into sex-trafficking, certify their team members are not near hazardous chemicals,
do not overwork craftspeople, treat staff with respect, and pay employees livable wages, you are creating healthy livelihoods and mental well-being in our communities.


Reforest and Rebuild a Stronger Working Community Worldwide :
Fibre Athletics supports environmental restoration
and poverty alleviation groups around the world.  Your purchase helps us
fund our inaugural Impact Partners: Eden Reforestation Project and The Cara
Program.  Our work with Eden restores degraded land and creates sorely needed jobs in
local communities in Ethiopia, Madagascar, Haiti and Nepal. Collaborating with The Cara Program prepares and
inspires over 700 motivated individuals to break the cycle of homelessness and
poverty, transform lives, and strengthen our current population.










Steve Sullivan (CEO/Founder): Over 20 years of service management and non-profit leadership experience helping launch and rejuvenate two multi-million dollar non-profits in Chicago (The Cara Program and Public Allies).
Sadie Monroe (Creative Director/Partner): Artist and designer based in Chicago. In addition to her independent practice, Monroe co-founded co.lab in 2012, an experimental art and design platform focusing on collaboration. 



We have worked closely with our product
developer and our vendors, completing several rounds of prototypes to test fit,
comfort, and durability in the designs. In addition, we are manufacturing
locally enabling us to oversee quality in our products and address unforeseen
challenges promptly.


Our first round of signature items are ready to begin production so the first backers of our Pursuit Top and Everywhere Jacket will be will be shipped their goods in a timely manner. Once we have sold through those items currently in production, we will need to place a new order to fulfill your perk purchase.  We have done our best to have backup materials lined up to cut and sew your clothing as quickly as possible and ship your order.

    


There are many ways you can help with our campaign! Any pledge is greatly appreciated, but we also encourage you to help us spread the word about our campaign to as many people as possible! Share our link by email, on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. 
Beyond our campaign, please consider supporting the hard working businesses and organizations keeping manufacturing in the USA. They sacrifice additional profit in order to create and keep jobs in the US.  Many of these same companies look to Recycle and use Organic materials to manufacture their goods, benefitting all of us now and later.                 Support Sustainable, Ethically Crafted, and Made in USA products. 

Tell Me More about the Materials and Their Production :The Everywhere Fleece Jacket is made from 100% organic cotton from Texas and our Pursuit Top is 100% recycled polyester (from recycled water bottles) coming from Taiwan and OEKO-TEX 100 certified (a respected and stringent environmental certification system in the textile industry).  Both products are cut and sewn in Chicago, IL. Our Fibre Tee is made 60% Hemp and 40% organic cotton and manufactured in New York.  The raw materials are ethically sourced from the US, China & Indonesia. The Fibre Cap is made from 65% recycled polyester and 35% organic cotton.  It is manufactured in New Jersey with materials sourced from India which are GOTS certified (The Global Organic Textile Standard : worldwide leading textile processing standard for organic fibres).The Water Bottle is 90% Recycled Aluminum and made by US Veterans in Zero Waste factory in Washington. The Fibre Ragg Wool Hat is  50% organic wool and 50% eco-polyester made from recycled soda bottles sourced in the US and manufactured in New Jersey. What are the work conditions and wages like for the people making these products? Fibre  Athletics is a Chicago Fair Trade company and our vendors provide safe working conditions and livable wages throughout our supply chain.

Flatters your natural shape to comfortably and stably cover your body         while active
Achieves the perfect balance of fit; avoiding skin-tight spandex and boxy, ill-fitting tops

Hood stays out of your way when not needed

The high-standing collar keeps your neck warm by itself
Collar can be folded down when not in use

Adds warmth your body in cold weather

Increase comfort, minimizing chafing while you’re wearing the jacket

Stabilize seams where they tend to stretch over time and use

story:
The Problem

Have you or someone you know ever tried to move a full size safe to a basement or upper floor location?  Have you ever moved and had to pay extra to move your safe?

The Solution

The Tongue and Groove safe is a full size modular safe that breaks down into manageable pieces for easy movement, yet secure enough to protect your valuables.

Our Design

With most  large safes on the market it is very difficult to place them in a home or business without professional safe movers.  Tongue and Groove Safes offer an exciting new design that alleviates this problem.
We have designed a full size fire and gun safe that is portable.  The Tongue and Groove Safe solves the moving problem by slicing a large safe into horizontal sections that can be taken apart and rebuilt multiple times without compromising the integrity of the safe.  This is done by incorporating  patent-pending "Tongue and Groove" units within the safe walls. The safe can become taller simply by ordering additional sections and a larger door.

Our Future Plans

In order for a safe to be sold it requires stress,heat and breach testing. Each prototype cost upward of $8,000 to build by hand. Then each is basically destroyed to make sure it can withstand breaching from thieves along with fire and water protection. Only after rigid testing can it be manufactured and offered to the public for sale.
By supporting our Tongue and Groove campaign you will help us  patent, build and test our new safe design so we can offer it to a manufacturer for construction.

Our Construction

We are excited to bring you not only a modular portable safe, but one that can hold your guns and valuables securely for many years to come. As the owner you will be able to move the Tongue and Groove Safe multiple times without the requirement of expensive safe movers or disgruntled friends. Each section is designed to weigh less than 150 lbs. With it's design it can be bolted to the floor or wall or both to prevent moving after being placed in a location of your choice.  A normal  61 inch gun safe will consist of a base, a top, and three middle sections  With three inches of concrete insulation in the walls, it's not your standard modular safe.

Our Philosophy

Because we are a family oriented outdoor group and gun owners, we know the importance of keeping guns stored safely when not in use. Too many accidents have occurred because guns were left exposed to children. The T & G Safe will make it not only easy but convenient to protect your guns and valuables.

Our People

The Tongue and Groove Safe can help you protect your valuables, your firearms and your family.

Our small group of four investors at Tongue and Groove Safes believe in the 2nd Amendment which guarantees American citizens the " Right to keep and bear arms".  We also believe it is the responsibility of all citizens to secure any and all weapons when not being used.

Our Resolve

In addition, our campaign allows our contributors the option of allocating 10% of their donations to the Sempher Fi Fund or a program of their choice in lieu of collecting a perk. We believe that all returning vets have laid it on the line to protect our Country and our Constitution and this is one way we can thank them for their sacrifice. 
By funding our campaign you will help us patent and develop the newest and most exciting design in safes in over 100 years and also help a returning vet.

Our Connection

Visit our Website, like us on Facebook and ask three of your friends to do the same . Please ask us questions or make suggestions.  We'd love to hear from you.

Our Request

Don't forget we need your financial support. Remember to  push the Contribute button!

Referrals

If you wish to help our campaign and earn extra perks please view our perks and select a contribution amount. Then visit Indiegogo to set up your specific URL for tracking purposes.

Our Thanks

Our sincere thanks to you and our vets from Colorado Springs, Colorado and around the world....and remember to thank a vet for their service.

The Team at T & G Safes.

story:
Introduction

Meet Candy Queen, our brand ambassador, virtual fashionista, and ruler of her own fashion brand Candy Queen Store!

Candy Queen Store is a pick and mix clothing concept for young girls! Our unique range consists of detachable icons that pop on and off our t-shirts. Our fun products encourage girls to pick, mix and collect our limited editions icons.


Candy Queen Store has had significant success selling into prestigious department stores, such a Selfridges & Co, Fenwick and Sugar Factory, USA.



Unfortunately, as the brand was growing, our supplier went into liquidation, taking all of the company's remaining cash flow and stock, therefore we were unable to develop and deliver new products to our customers.




What we need

We are hoping to raise £3,000 to develop our new collection.

  • Funding will be used to revive the brand by developing and sampling new products. Our collection will offer further customisable features such as customisable sleeves and collars, along with more styles and colourways. 

The Impact

With the use of your funds, our samples will be photographed, e-brochured and sent to key retail buyers across Europe and the US to gain forward orders. Your support will rebuild our brand, once again.

Our visual merchandising in Sugar Factory, Las Vegas

Our visual merchandising at Selfridges & Co

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please spread the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools and share through social media!

story:
Présentation

Salut ! Je m’appelle Jean-Pierre Bourhis, j’ai 20 ans et j’ai une passion : le canoë slalom ! Licencié au club de Quimper Cornouaille, je représente désormais la fédération Sénégalaise de canoë . Cette année sera des plus audacieuses : étudiant en génie mécanique et automatique à l’INSA de Rennes, je viens également d’être sélectionné aux JO de Rio en canoë slalom !

Ce projet olympique, je veux le vivre avec vous. Faites partie du rêve !

Prêt ? Voici mon histoire !

Je commence le kayak à l’âge de 8 ans et me tourne tout de suite vers la compétition, car gagner, me surpasser, j’adore ça. Je commence à courir pour le Sénégal, le pays de mes grands-parents, à l’âge de 17 ans.

Avancer, aller de l’avant, il le faut pour atteindre l’excellence. Cette image symbolise le combat au quotidien que je mène pour réussir.

Si vous ne connaissez pas encore mon sport, le voici !

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xIfz3qqsNes

C'est une course contre la montre où les concurrents doivent suivre un parcours comportant de 18 à 25 portes, de couleur rouge ou verte. On doit passer entre les portes sans les toucher, dans le sens de la descente pour les vertes, en remontée pour les rouges. Le temps réalisé est converti en points (1 point = 1 seconde). Il y a deux types de pénalités: une touche donne une pénalité de 2 points, tandis qu'une porte franchie de manière incorrecte entraîne 50 points de pénalité. Les pénalités sont ajoutées au temps réalisé.

Les 2 catégories à différencier sont le canoë (à genou avec une pagaie simple, issu des indiens d'Amérique) et le kayak (assis avec une pagaie double, issu des eskimo).

Pourquoi me soutenir dans ma préparation Olympique ?

Le plus grand obstacle pour arriver fin prêt aux Jeux Olympiques de Rio n’est pas mon niveau, mais le financement de ma préparation jusqu’au jour J.

Comme le slalom est une discipline naissante dans mon pays, le Sénégal, je ne bénéficie pas encore d'aide de la part de la fédération de canoë kayak, du comité national olympique et sportif sénégalais ou du ministère des Sports.

Je suis le premier slalomeur de l’histoire du Sénégal à me qualifier au Jeux Olympiques ! Ce faisant, je pose la première pierre du slalom sénégalais. 

En tant qu’étudiant, ma situation personnelle et mes revenus limités ne me permettent pas d’assumer les frais liés à cette préparation olympique. Pourtant, de ce double projet, je tire ma force et mon équilibre.

J’ai pu participé à de nombreux championnats du monde, coupes du monde et championnats continentaux africains sous les couleurs du Sénégal. Au fil des années, j’ai gagné en expérience pour finalement me classer 7ème place au Pré Olympiques en novembre 2015, ce qui fait de moi le plus jeune athlète à réaliser cette performance pour Rio 2016 !

Le budget de ma saison olympique

Cette campagne de financement participatif servira à couvrir les frais liés à ma préparation sportive jusqu’aux JO de Rio et me permettra aussi de renouveler mon équipement sportif.

Voici le détail de mon budget : 

Frais de compétition et stage  22 300 €

Matériel  6100 €

Budget Total  28 400 €

Je souhaite couvrir ce budget grâce à 2 sources de financement :

D'une part, à l'aide d'un travail de proximité que je mène auprès du comité national olympique et sportif, du ministère des sports sénégalais et de partenariats privés . 

D'autre part,  je sollicite pour moitié (14000€) votre aide et votre soutien dans mon (notre) aventure olympique .

Mon programme jusqu’aux JO de Rio

Au regard de votre participation à cette aventure humaine je m'engage à vous faire partager mon quotidien par le biais de newsletters, photos, vidéos ! 

Je vous emmènerai de Bretagne, en Italie, en passant par les Pyrénées-Atlantiques, la Pologne, l'Espagne pour finalement atterrir du côté de Copacabanna : Rio !

Découvrez mon programme mois après mois !

Février

Du 6 au 13 : Stage de préparation à Pau (France)

Mars

Stage de préparation à Pau (France)

Avril

Du 18 au 29 : Stage de préparation sur le bassin olympique de Rio (Brésil)

Mai

Du 2 au 22  : Stage de préparation, à Pau et Ivréa (Italie)

Juin

Du 6 au 12 : Coupe du monde 2 à Séo d’Urgell (Espagne)

Du 13 au 19 : Coupe du monde 3 à Pau (France)

Du 22 au 30 : stage de préparation à Rio (Brésil)

Juillet

Du 4 au 10 : Championnat du monde des moins de 23 ans Cracovie (Pologne)

Du 15 au 30 : stage de préparation à Rio (Brésil)

Aout

Du 5 au 11 : Jeux Olympiques Rio 2016 (Brésil)

Merci à tous!


                                                 Be part of the dream! 

Présentation

Hi Guys!

My name is Jean-Pierre Bourhis, I’m 20 years old and I have a passion: canoe slalom!

I’m racing for Senegal and this year is a special one: while I’m studying mechanical engineering, I have been selected   for for Rio 2016 Olympic Games!

I don’t want to embark on this Olympic journey alone. I want to share it with you: be part of this dream!

Ready? So let’s go:

I started paddling when I was 8 and I almost immediatly was keen on competing. On  winning and surpassing myself… I simply love it!

When I was 17, I competed for the very first time for Senegal, my grandparents’ country.

Always moving forward is the path to reach excellence.I work and train hard  everyday to achieve this aim!


If you don’t know much about canoe slalom, have a look at this  : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xIfz3qqsNes

Canoe slalom is a race against the clock through a combination of up and downstream gates on a whitewater course. The number of gates varies with a minimum of 18 to a  maximum of 25 gates. The direction the athlete must travel through each gate is indicated by colour: red for upstream and green for downstream.

There are a minimum of six upstream gates on each course.

Athletes can incur time penalties with two-seconds added for a gate touch and 50-seconds for wrong negociation of a gate.

In kayak (created by Eskimos), the paddler is seated and uses a double-bladed paddle pulling the blade through the water on alternate sides to propel the boat forward.

In canoe (created by Indians from North America), the paddle has a single-blade and the athlete is strapped into the boat with their legs bent at the knees and tucked under their body.

Why I’m asking you to support me on my way to Rio:

Since I got selected to attend Rio 2016 and ended up 7th at the pre-Games event last fall, I’ve proved that I am now one of the recognized world-class paddlers and I keep on training hard to be ready for D-Day. I attended many World Cups, World Championships and Continental Championships. On and on, I got enough experience to get myself ranked 7th at the Pre-Olympic Games in November 2015. I’m 20 and I’m the youngest C1 at this position for Rio 2016.

Meanwhile, funding my preparation for the Olympics is an other story.

I’m the first Slalom paddler ever qualified for Olympic Games. Slalom is at its very beginning in my country, thus supports from Senegal National Federation, Senegal Olympic Committee or Ministry of Sports are not yet available.

A student-athlete, I’m very proud to be continuing both studying and training : this dual project brings me an iron will, sustainable motivation and balance.  Meanwhile,  being a student doesn’t help with finance and this status doesn’t allow me to fund my sport season. That’s why I decided to launch a crowdfunding campaign.


The budget of my Olympic season

This money raised throught this crowdfunding campaign will cover my preparation (training camps, trips, equipment) until August 2016, time of the Games.

Training camps  22 300 €

Equipment 6100 €

Total  Budget 28 400 €

I want to cover these expenses in 2 ways :

On the one hand, I’m currently working closely with my NOC, Ministry of Sports and private sponsorships to get half of my season funded.

On the other hand, I will to raise half of my budget (14 000 €) thanks to your support in my/our Olympic dream.

My roadmap to Rio

Once you step into this human adventure, I will share with you my everyday olympic athlete life by newletters, videos, pictures. Together, we’ll travel from Brittany in France to Italy, Pyrénées-Atlantiques in France, Poland, Spain and finally we’ll land next to Coppacabana: Rio!

February

6-13 : Training camp Pau (France)

March

Training camp Pau (France)

April

18-29 : Training camp Deodoro, on the Olympic venue

May

2-22  : Training camp in Pau (France) and Ivrea (Italy)

June

 6-12 : World Cup 2 Séo d’Urgell (Spain)

13-19 : World Cup 3 Pau (France)

22-30 : Training camp Deodoro, on the Olympic venue

July

4-10 : World Championships U23 in Krakow (Poland)

1530 : Training camp Deodoro, on the Olympic venue

August

5-11 : OLYMPIC GAMES in RIO

                                                            MERCI

story:
I'M RAISING FUNDS FOR THE FIRST PRODUCTION LINE OF BIRD TROUBLE'S NEW HANDCRAFTED VEGAN CONVERTIBLE WAXED CANVAS BAG // BACKPACK, TOTE BAG, + SHOULDER BAG IN ONE 



Be passionate about the change you want to see in the world. Stay WILD & FREE.

HELLO THERE! Bird Trouble's mission is to be an online and mobile retail boutique providing a line of fair-trade bags, accessories, clothing, and skateboards for those with a rad lifestyle by SPRING 2016.



  • If you don't know me, my name is Alexz Sandoval and I am a Chicago based bag and accessory designer. I've been running my brand, Bird Trouble, since 2009 and have sold nearly 1,000 of my handmade products. All Bird Trouble bags and accessories, from the pattern design, to the prototype, to the final products are created by myself - as well as the business side of the business. 

  • In 2013, I decided to stop working for other people and turned Bird Trouble into my FULL-TIME JOB. That is the year I also decided to move to Mexico, to travel and connect to my heritage. Having family from Mexico truly inspires my work.

  • Supporting my campaign is supporting a maker with bigger dreams of stocking Bird Trouble's first currently-being-renovated 1978 Dodge Campervan MOBILE SHOP.

  • By Spring 2016, the Bird Trouble Mobile Shop should be ready to hit the road. I hope to take it to pop-ups, trade shows, festivals, markets, and nearly anywhere we can share our products and story. I plan to be stationed in Chicago for a few months as well as travel to other great cities across the USA. I can't wait to meet you along the way!




    A 3-IN-1 FUNCTIONAL, STYLISH, AND SUSTAINABLE BAG BY BIRD TROUBLE, CHICAGO
  • For over a year, I've been looking forward to creating a great vegan style bag that is good-looking, functional, and affordable... so I created the VEGAN CONVERTIBLE WAXED CANVAS BAG. This design of bag is important to me because I'll be able to support an innovative side of the Fashion Industry, even at a smaller scale, by offering a RAD VEGAN STYLE.

    MEASUREMENTS: 22" tall x 10" base width x 15" top width x 5" depth

  • With your support and contribution, I'll be able to make a run of 20 VEGAN CONVERTIBLE WAXED CANVAS ready-made bags by Spring 2016. These 20 ready-made bags will be stocked inside of Bird Trouble's FIRST MOBILE BOUTIQUE (releasing Spring 2016 at a Chicago pop-up near you) and at a few of our favorite small businesses in Chicago and with your help, across the GLOBE!



What We Need

WE NEED TO RAISE A TOTAL OF $3,250. LET ME BREAK IT DOWN FOR YOU:

In order to make 20 ready-made bags, I'll need to raise $2,800. In total, I'll need to raise $3,250.

With the $2,800 I'll be able to order materials for the production of the bags along with setting aside a little money toward licensing and appropriate plans for the Bird Trouble's MOBILE BOUTIQUE fund + toward our 2016 Collection fund, as well as pay myself a fair-wage labor.

  • I'll need about $200 to cover campaign and bank fees.
  • I'll also need about $250 to cover shipping costs and any additional costs that may come up... since Bird Trouble is a small business, we can not make any mistakes!

    What You Get
  • In exchange for a $99 pledge, we're offering... the VEGAN WAXED CANVAS BAG IN BLACK AT AN EARLY-BIRD SPECIAL PRE-ORDER PRICE OF $99 // NORMALLY RETAILED AT $140. For $99 + shipping, you'll receive ONE Vegan Waxed Canvas Bag in BLACK -OR- YOUR CHOICE OF COLOR + a goodie bag filled with Bird Trouble stickers, postcards, and a thank you note.

    If you'd like another color other than black, please leave a note in your pledge or email me after you pledge, with 1) your name and 2) choice of color from below.






  • In exchange for a $199 pledge, we're offering our classic BLACK LEATHER DEBBIE SATCHEL AT A SPECIAL BACKER PRICE. For $199 + shipping, you'll receive ONE Debbie Satchel in black + textile handmade in Oaxaca, Mexico + a goodie bag filled with Bird Trouble stickers, postcards, and a thank you note. // Normally retailing at $345!!!




  • In exchange for a $30 pledge, we're offering our classic ONE OF A KIND JANIS MEDICINE POUCH AT A SPECIAL BACKER PRICE. For $30 + shipping, you'll receive ONE one of a kind Janis Medicine Pouch +  a goodie bag filled with Bird Trouble stickers, postcards, and a thank you note. // Normally retailing at $40!




    Even if we do not meet our goal of $3,250...     your support will mean the world to Bird Trouble. As a small business, anything helps! I will still be able to create the products I'm offering in exchange of your pledge, and I'll still be able to start funding for the 2016 Collection of our 20 Ready-Made Vegan Waxed Canvas Bags.

The Impact You'll Make!

NOT ONLY DOES YOUR SUPPORT HELP BIRD TROUBLE, IT HELPS OUR MISSION TO SUPPORT THE FAIR-TRADE FASHION MOVEMENT.

  • Within the next year, Bird Trouble will offer fair wages and employment to a small team of indigineous artisans in Mexico who practice traditional techniques in order to grow our inventory and offer sustainable fashion to our following.
  • Bird Trouble will continue to grow their e-blog to inspire and share tips about the community of Mobile Small Businesses we meet on our journey. We believe in making and sharing the movement.
  • We plan to support the Fair-Trade Fashion Movement that tests fast-fashion trends and build a larger supportive community who believes in sustainable fashion options, to better the earth we live on.
  • Last year, with your help, I raised $2,500 through Bird Trouble's FIRST SUCCESSFUL KICKSTARTER. With those funds, I made a ton of great products for you guys and I sent my line to NYC, to appear in a marketing event that supported FAIR-TRADE FASHION.
  • For the last few years, with our community's support, Bird Trouble has been runner up as the BEST INDIE CRAFTER in Chicago and LAST YEAR in 2015, we WON! 

    VISIT THE BIRD TROUBLE PRESS MENTION PAGE.
     
  • If you need more convincing... connect with me at a personal level! Send me a shout out through my INSTAGRAM, read my FACEBOOK REVIEWS or my ETSY REVIEWS, and spend some time on my BLOG.



    ACCION CHICAGO AWARD // INVOLVEMENT IN SEED CHICAGO, in growing jobs and facilitating economic growth in Chicago // July 2015






Risks, Challenges, & Turn-Around Times

We're kind of on a time crunch! That being said...

  • On January 18 2016, I'm leaving for a MEXICO business trip, to work on the Bird Trouble 2016 Collection and soak up some inspiration, so...

    - IF YOU ORDER BY DECEMBER 23RD 2015, I'll send your bag by January 15th. 
    - IF YOU ORDER AFTER DECEMBER 23RD 2015, I'll start making your bag when I get back, on or around, March 1st and I'll ship it by March 31st.
  • One of my specialities is in communication. I promise to keep you in the loop, to share any news and all updates via email, IndieGoGo updates, and @BirdTrouble Instagram updates.

  • We may run into more problems with the BIRD TROUBLE MOBILE SHOP DEADLINE. It takes a lot of work to set up the permits, licenses, and all the business side in order that our business plan runs smoothly. This does NOT mean we won't get there, it just means we may not have it ready by Spring 2016.



Other Ways You Can Help

We truly understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

1) MAKE SOME NOISE. Share our campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools. Share our project with your friends on Facebook, Pinterest, Tumblr, your Blog, your Instagram, or anywhere!

2) SEND US A LINK. If you share our campaign, be sure to send us a link in the comments! We'll send you a SPECIAL BACKER DISCOUNT CODE for BIRDTROUBLE.COM - one that will never expire!

3) ENTER IN OUR $50 GIFT CERTIFICATE GIVEAWAY . By sharing a link of where you shared our campaign in our IndieGoGo's comments, you'll be automatically entered into a $50 GIFT CERTIFICATE GIVEAWAY TOWARD BIRDTROUBLE.COM... just don't forget to send us a link! The more you share, the more you're entered in!

WE JUST REALLY LIKE YOU! And that's all there is to it.

With the $2,800 I'll be able to order materials for the production of the bags along with setting aside a little money toward licensing and appropriate plans for the Bird Trouble's MOBILE BOUTIQUE fund + toward our 2016 Collection fund, as well as pay myself a fair-wage labor.

I'll need about $200 to cover campaign and bank fees.
I'll also need about $250 to cover shipping costs and any additional costs that may come up... since Bird Trouble is a small business, we can not make any mistakes!What You Get
 In exchange for a $99 pledge, we're offering... the VEGAN WAXED CANVAS BAG IN BLACK AT AN EARLY-BIRD SPECIAL PRE-ORDER PRICE OF $99 // NORMALLY RETAILED AT $140. For $99 + shipping, you'll receive ONE Vegan Waxed Canvas Bag in BLACK -OR- YOUR CHOICE OF COLOR + a goodie bag filled with Bird Trouble stickers, postcards, and a thank you note.If you'd like another color other than black, please leave a note in your pledge or email me after you pledge, with 1) your name and 2) choice of color from below.

In exchange for a $199 pledge, we're offering our classic BLACK LEATHER DEBBIE SATCHEL AT A SPECIAL BACKER PRICE. For $199 + shipping, you'll receive ONE Debbie Satchel in black + textile handmade in Oaxaca, Mexico + a goodie bag filled with Bird Trouble stickers, postcards, and a thank you note. // Normally retailing at $345!!!



In exchange for a $30 pledge, we're offering our classic ONE OF A KIND JANIS MEDICINE POUCH AT A SPECIAL BACKER PRICE. For $30 + shipping, you'll receive ONE one of a kind Janis Medicine Pouch +  a goodie bag filled with Bird Trouble stickers, postcards, and a thank you note. // Normally retailing at $40!
Even if we do not meet our goal of $3,250... your support will mean the world to Bird Trouble. As a small business, anything helps! I will still be able to create the products I'm offering in exchange of your pledge, and I'll still be able to start funding for the 2016 Collection of our 20 Ready-Made Vegan Waxed Canvas Bags.
    The Impact You'll Make! NOT ONLY DOES YOUR SUPPORT HELP BIRD TROUBLE, IT HELPS OUR MISSION TO SUPPORT THE FAIR-TRADE FASHION MOVEMENT.

Within the next year, Bird Trouble will offer fair wages and employment to a small team of indigineous artisans in Mexico who practice traditional techniques in order to grow our inventory and offer sustainable fashion to our following.
Bird Trouble will continue to grow their e-blog to inspire and share tips about the community of Mobile Small Businesses we meet on our journey. We believe in making and sharing the movement.
We plan to support the Fair-Trade Fashion Movement that tests fast-fashion trends and build a larger supportive community who believes in sustainable fashion options, to better the earth we live on.
Last year, with your help, I raised $2,500 through Bird Trouble's FIRST SUCCESSFUL KICKSTARTER. With those funds, I made a ton of great products for you guys and I sent my line to NYC, to appear in a marketing event that supported FAIR-TRADE FASHION.
For the last few years, with our community's support, Bird Trouble has been runner up as the BEST INDIE CRAFTER in Chicago and LAST YEAR in 2015, we WON! VISIT THE BIRD TROUBLE PRESS MENTION PAGE.  If you need more convincing... connect with me at a personal level! Send me a shout out through my INSTAGRAM, read my FACEBOOK REVIEWS or my ETSY REVIEWS, and spend some time on my BLOG.ACCION CHICAGO AWARD // INVOLVEMENT IN SEED CHICAGO, in growing jobs and facilitating economic growth in Chicago // July 2015
    Risks, Challenges, & Turn-Around Times  We're kind of on a time crunch! That being said...  On January 18 2016, I'm leaving for a MEXICO business trip, to work on the Bird Trouble 2016 Collection and soak up some inspiration, so...- IF YOU ORDER BY DECEMBER 23RD 2015, I'll send your bag by January 15th. - IF YOU ORDER AFTER DECEMBER 23RD 2015, I'll start making your bag when I get back, on or around, March 1st and I'll ship it by March 31st.
 One of my specialities is in communication. I promise to keep you in the loop, to share any news and all updates via email, IndieGoGo updates, and @BirdTrouble Instagram updates.

We may run into more problems with the BIRD TROUBLE MOBILE SHOP DEADLINE. It takes a lot of work to set up the permits, licenses, and all the business side in order that our business plan runs smoothly. This does NOT mean we won't get there, it just means we may not have it ready by Spring 2016.

    Other Ways You Can Help We truly understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!1) MAKE SOME NOISE. Share our campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools. Share our project with your friends on Facebook, Pinterest, Tumblr, your Blog, your Instagram, or anywhere!2) SEND US A LINK. If you share our campaign, be sure to send us a link in the comments! We'll send you a SPECIAL BACKER DISCOUNT CODE for BIRDTROUBLE.COM - one that will never expire!3) ENTER IN OUR $50 GIFT CERTIFICATE GIVEAWAY . By sharing a link of where you shared our campaign in our IndieGoGo's comments, you'll be automatically entered into a $50 GIFT CERTIFICATE GIVEAWAY TOWARD BIRDTROUBLE.COM... just don't forget to send us a link! The more you share, the more you're entered in!  WE JUST REALLY LIKE YOU! And that's all there is to it.

story:
We are third year fashion students , studying at Bath Spa University. We are preparing for our final show extravaganza. We have to raise funds to put on our final showcase in form of a  professional fashion show. This is hugely important, as industry professionals are invited to watch and this opens up huge potential for us to get employed after graduating. As well as showcasing our final collections. 

With your help it will mean , we can have a  final show to be proud of!

What We Need & What You Get

Between our final year of 17 we have to raise at least £7000 , (models alone cost £9000) So the money we raise goes towards  professional lighting , music, staging and show producers.

If after supporting the cause , you would like to see what YOUR contribution has made possible , please contact  us on  holly.pendlebury12@bathspa.ac.uk  ( £5 ,27th April , BATH ) .


The Impact

Bath Spa fashion department, is an incredibly young course , yet what it has achieved in such a short time , really sets the standard high for our year. In 2012 and 2014 Final year students won GOLD at Graduate Fashion Week , as well in 2013 and 2014 Student winning and coming runners up at FAD. 

The course prides itself on its professionalism and this is continued through to the fashion show , which would not be out of place at London Fashion Week!


Other Ways You Can Help

If money is tight and you cannot support us, please share to all your friends and colleagues and help us make a show we will be proud of!

story:
When kids start elementary school, most parents' frustrations start from nagging reminders to kids about doing homework, taking shower, going to bed and etc. It just never ends. Could a conventional watch help kids build time awareness? 

What if a device that helps your kids to learn time management naturally, that encourages parent-child interactions and also being entertaining?


Meet JUMPY

After months of research and investigation, our team has created JUMPY, an innovative and multi-functional smart watch for kids of age 4+.

"Helping your kids to learn time management naturally" is the core of JUMPY's design concept. To achieve this, JOYRAY developed a series of Apps, such as smart reminders, fun and interactive games, pet nursery, coach-guided pedo-games, messaging and smart toy control. We wish JUMPY to be every child's first watch and able to accompany them for a joyful childhood.

JUMPY is an Android and iOS compatible device with Bluetooth connectivity and motion sensing technology that allows it to interact with other JUMPYs, Smartphones and Bluetooth smart toys. 

Features

Award

Press Coverage

TechCrunch: One of the reasons I like Jumpy is because its creators are eager to make sure children use the smartwatch to interact with their parents and the world around them, instead of just staring at its screen.

NIKKEI TRENDY NET: 子供向けとはいえ、Apple Watchに迫る機能を持っていたのは、台湾メーカーJoyray Tech.の「Jumpy My First Watch」。

36Kr: 与其说这是一块手表，倒不如说JUMPY是一个平台。它内置了几款应用，有模拟乐器的，还有像Apple Watch一样发表情的，还有控制智能小球Sphero。

TECH in ASIA-Keeping both children and parents happy is a core part of Chang’s vision for Jumpy.


What CAN JUMPY DO

1. Unlimited Fun for Kids

JUMPY to be every kid's first watch to accompany them in their healthy growth.

While listening and following the storyteller, kids stretch their hands and legs, imitate a cat, fight with robbers and etc. The interactive game brings a whole new story-telling experience.

JUMPY is unlimited

JUMPY works great with our partners’ gaming Apps and comes with open SDK for 3rd-party developers so that more professionals will have the opportunities and fun developing innovative Apps for JUMPY and further extend its functionality. We are also working on JUMPY App Store and plan to launch on 2016.

The possibility can be endless!

2. For Caring Parents 


JUMPY Connect 

JUMPY Connect is a mobile companion App dedicated for parents to connect JUMPY with below features.

3. Kid-Centric Design

  • Passed 1.5 meters drop test, long life even on the wrist of the most naughty kids
  • ASTM F963 and EN71 toy safety standards, avoiding skin irritation, radiation, rigid angle and other problems
  • 14-20cm band width tailored design for kids of age 4+


  • 1.6 inch touchscreen – easy to operate by kids’ fingers  

  • Fun color combos available, TMNT Green, Barbie Pink, Clobberin’ Orange & Captain Blue.


  • Changeable watch band gives kids options of styles they like and easy to clean
  • Easy charging design - a magnetic charger head can be handled easily by kids themselves
  • Long battery life - 420mAH big battery + transfective TFT screen to save power 

Technical Specification 

How it Works

JUMPY is loaded with features and can be synced with other smart devices through Bluetooth and back up the data to JUMPY Cloud through WiFi,  Parents can simply use their smartphones or iPads to access to the data for a better understanding of their kids’ daily activities.

JUMPY’s ecosystem contains following components: smart watch (JUMPY), mobile App (JUMPY Connect), back-end server (JUMPY Cloud) and App store. The image below provides an overview of how JUMPY ecosystem works.


Development Stage

The mission we set up at the beginning of our project is to create products that bring “Unprecedented First Watch Experience" straight to kids’ wrists. After over a year's dedication to the project on researching and collaborating with renowned child psychologists, educationists, and interactive App developers while monitoring and fine tuning the production tools and process night and day in the lab and factory, we are proud to announce that JUMPY Generation 1 is now ready to be delivered to your hands.

Currently, Android version JUMPY is available, and iOS version will meet the market in December 2015.

Furthermore, we are also working on more Apps and contents that enrich JUMPY and bring kids and parents unique experience of smart watch.

What we are still working on:

  • Dedicated iOS version JUMPY Watch
  • iOS JUMPY Connect, the App works on iPhone and iPad.
  • integrating more smart toys that kids can play with over JUMPY
  • APP stores that more educational and entertaining APPs and contents can be downloaded to your JUMPY.

JUMPY now is a real product, your helper and your kids' best friend. It's the result of over a year's sketching, testing, developing, designing and building. Now your direct support is very much needed, buying a JUMPY either the Android version which can be shipped to you right away, or an iOS version that will be available in December as the best Christmas gift for your kids!   



Referrals

Earn $15 in credits every time one of your referrals purchases a JUMPY. The amount of credit you can earn is unlimited! Once the campaign finishes, we will apply the credits to your account, giving you a refund on your purchase or credit on the purchase of a new JUMPY. 

How to participate in the referral program:

Be sure to use the same Indiegogo account you use when you claim your JUMPY. Then, link our main video at the top of this page for buttons to share and copy your unique URL. Please note that contributors cannot receive referral credit for referring themselves.  

Earn a free JUMPY now!


JUMPY is a startup dedicated to children smart watch. Members with an average of 12 years' working experience are from Fortune 500 tier one Branded, ODM and OEM companies, such as Foxconn, Compal and Acer. 


Strategic Partners 

Foxconn, a well-known #1 ODM/OEM manufacturer globally and the selected partner of Apple Watch & iPhone/iPad, supports JUMPY on system design, quality assurance, certification and mass production. UTICO, a market leader focuses on smart toys and smart devices design and development.

Risk and Challenge

The process of developing a smart watch is a complex combination of engineering efforts and management of supply chain, production, and logistics.  By partnering the global EMS company, Foxconn, we successfully introduced JUMPY Generation 1 into the market.

We are now developing iOS dedicated JUMPY and iOS version JUMPY Connect together with the partner. The risk of delivering product to the market is minimum; and currently a new task to the team is to submit the APP to iTUNE .  With the help of the strategic partner, we believe we can manage to secure the delivery of iOS version in December 2015.

story:
Shoes are not our only purpose. We want to help your feet and soul by ensuring that we give others a leg up.  Our company believes in three things: 

THE SHARING ECONOMY

As a monthly subscriber, you select your favorite pairs from our dynamic collection of women's new and pre-worn shoes.  Then, we send one of those pairs right to your door.  When you are done being fabulous, just send them back to receive the next pair.  Shipping is free both ways.  By renting instead of purchasing, you minimize consumerism and still enjoy the latest trends.     

BEING STYLISH SHOULD NOT BREAK YOUR BANK OR YOUR FEET 

Our flat rate rental service is an affordable way to get access to your dream shoe collection. And unlike traditional retailers, you can actually wear and test drive different styles to see which shoes work best for your unique feet prior to making a commitment!   

FASHION CAN NOT ONLY HEAL THE SPIRIT BUT CONTRIBUTE TO HEALING SOCIAL AND ECONOMICAL MALADIES

Fashion can not only heal the spirit but contribute to healing social and economical maladies. 

That's why we are devoted to empowering young girls and women through the best way we know how: YOU! Whenever you fall in love with a pair of rental heels that make you feel like the incredible, inspirational person that you are and decide to purchase them, we will make a donation to one of our NGO partners that is helping to solve issues affecting young girls and women across the world.

Your generous support will help us to launch our business by providing technology development, inventory purchase, and fulfillment support. Together, we can make a fashionable statement and leave a lasting impact.  Please contribute today to receive the perks for yourself or give it as a wonderful gift!

story:
www.befrankofficial.com

be.Frank really only has two core values:

EXCEPTIONAL BACKPACK DESIGNS

First and foremost we are committed to designing exceptional backpacks of the highest quality. These backpacks are going to look great! Trust me! Myself and a talented Fashion Design Graduate from Melbourne are currently working on these designs and we are not rushing a thing. EVERY detail EVERY feature and EVERY stitch will be thought about and most importantly - they are going to look great. Think modern, think fashionable.... everyone is going to want one - whether student, university student, sports enthusiast, young professional... boy or girl or anything in between! 

PAY IT FORWARD

However, the whole concept of be.Frank is to give back to those in need. "Pay it forward" if you like. I personally have worked closely with an exceptional international charity and have been to Kupang on the Timor island of Indonesia to see their work and meet a child I sponsor there. I have also had 7 years experience of teaching in a secondary school in England. Education is so important. Owning a great, functional school bag will be fantastic for kids in communities where having such a luxury is unheard of. Imagine the smiles on the faces of 100s of kids as they arrange their school books and equipment in their new be.Frank school bag. This small gesture from be.Frank can truly inspire children to take education seriously, to empower them with the ethos that they can be whoever they want to be! Using the money raised, we are committed to send at least 250 new school bags to kids living in deprived communities across Asia, South America and Africa in Year 1. As be.Frank grows this will always be one of our 2 core values. We hope to get to the stage where we are sending out 1000s of school bags to kids across the world each and every year. 

Social Media is so important these days right?! Influential bloggers, Instagrammers and YouTubers have already been targeted and since our core values are so important - I am positive many will support and help grow be.Frank

story:
Taylor Bros. Chair Co. - A Family Affair

Taylor Bros Chair Co. is comprised of (actual) brothers Rich and Chris Taylor, originally from Dundas, Ontario, Canada.  We are both former university level baseball players who have combined several of our favourite past times - sports, cottages and beer - into our new business venture.  Our goal is simple: we aim to create unique, high-quality, customized, hand-crafted furniture for individuals and businesses to display, promote, market and, most of all, relax and ENJOY.  All of our products are hand-crafted with great care and meticulous attention to detail in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our funding goal is $10,000.  All funds raised in our campaign will go directly toward our start up costs - finding shop and/or retail space to build and store our products, purchasing/improving tools and equipment, incorporating costs, marketing and promotion, and bulk ordering of raw materials.

As a "thank you" for your helping us out with a very generous contribution to our campaign, we are offering several really cool perks to acknowledge your assistance:

  • Taylor Bros vinyl stickers
  • Taylor Bros 3/4 baseball tees
  • New Era 58/50 fitted caps w/ Taylor Bros logo
  • Taylor Bros pro maple 33" baseball bats
  • Taylor Bros bat knob mountable coat racks
  • Taylor Bros signature baseball bat barstool
  • Taylor Bros signature baseball bat barstool

Please check out our image gallery for photos of some of the perks!!

Other Ways You Can Help:

We totally understand that not everyone can afford to contribute.   If you can help us out in other ways, we'd really appreciate it!

  • Please tell your friends and family about our campaign!  Spread the word!  MAKE SOME NOISE!
  • Check out our website, Twitter & Instagram feeds and Facebook page!

  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
UGLOW IS UNIQUE -  WE PRODUCE 100% STITCHLESS APPAREL 

WE MAKE MAGNETIC POCKET MORE CONVENIENT AND EFFICIENT

STITCHLESS COMFORT -REVOLUTIONARY MAGNETIZE™ POCKETS
WEAR UGLOW  and  SHINE ON!


UGLOW is a premium outdoor active wear clothing line made for comfort and durability.  We bring innovation to every new product we design, creating products that, before now, have never existed on the market.  Our customers are the outdoor sports elite also recreational sport people , so we ensure each and every piece is innovative, comfortable and durable for everyday wear.  The philosophy of our brand lies in our belief that everyone should feel comfortable, protected and safe while engaging in their favorite outdoor activity. You will appreciate the unprecedented b thanks to the stitch-less assembly technologies we developed; a combination of high-frequency bonding and overlap bonding as well as our very high end polyamide material.  Our smart magnetic closing system revolutionises the way you access your pockets.  It’s 50-percent faster and it’s safer than conventional zip type pockets, needing only one hand to access.

WHY ARE WE CROWDFUNDING ?

  •  Funds raised will help our company to raise sufficient volume for production quotas to be reached.
  •  Your support is important because we believe people make the difference, and by supporting us it also means talking about us, so having you on board there will help us develop our brand worldwide.
  • We are still small but with great ambitions and committed to make our brand a top brand on the international scene within 10 years. This would be impossible without your precious support.
  • We firmly believe that giving power to end user is definitely the way to satisfy them the most. Therefore we will make sure to always stay open and listen to what you, people, want.

WHY UGLOW IS UNIQUE

Here is why we believe strongly in our brand, values, products and design.

  • UNIQUE MANUFACTURING PROCESS Uglow is manufacturing 100% stitch-less products. This means that all our products are CHAFFING FREE, very confortable. Not many other brands dare to explore those directions, because the manufacturing processes we use are more expensive, production process takes longer. Uglow provides more features at a regular market price in order to give more leverage to its customer.
  • UNIQUE BREAKTHROUGHS We lead our OWN INNOVATION in our own development lab.
  • UNIQUE FABRICS We also develop our own FABRICS to reach higher standards of quality.
  • UNIQUE SMART CLOSING SYSTEM  MAGNETIZE™ is a revolution in this modern world.
  • UNIQUE TEAM We work for and develop along with Athletes our products, we design apparel and invent technologies. We keep our world moving everyday and trying to bring new fresh technologies to the market on an everyday basis.

OUR PERKS



OUR SIZING
 

 WARRANTY

We are confident in our products so we are offering our customers ONE YEAR! This means that if your product is failing after a correct use we will be happy to replace it for you.

FAQ

A. When are we going to receive our Uglow product?

Our goal is to begin shipping by the end of August 2016.

B. What comes in our Package?

Your ordered product(s) in our specific size and color.

C. Are Uglow Products only for Sport?

NO, they can be used either for sport activities or as casual wear.

They are functional products for our Vests and jackets ranges, so they can be used everyday.


D. What sizes does Uglow offer?

WOMEN: XS to L

MEN: S to XXL

E. Can I use  Uglow products as any other product?

You can practice with your product as hard as you want. However because of  its special built-in technologies we do recommend a cold hand wash, no ironing, no dry cleaning, no drying machine.

F. Do you have patents for your inventions?

Our FW16 collection is entirely protected for its innovative design and shapes.

G. I’m an international backer. Can you deliver to my country?

Yes! We deliver worldwide, but the shipping costs will be higher and we are not responsible for customs duties and procedures.

Thanks for supporting UGLOW and SHINE ON!

We hope you have enjoyed sharing with us in learning what Uglow is all about.  With Uglow, you shine and feel unique.  We need your support with this Fall – Winter collection 16.  Funds collected will help develop our brand and products worldwide.  Uglow is the future of sportswear and this opportunity to be the first to own a piece of our FW16 collection is unique. 


FOLLOW US!

story:
This is the next major offering from the ALPHA line for ROCKDEEP

  • This is your chance to get a quality product at a reasonable price.
  • In order to give everyone a chance to have these for the spring training and basketball court season, we are running this until the end of this month.
  • These will be released at $65 vs. our already low retail price of $88 

Our Goal

  • We are seeking $12,000 to raise for both pairs which means we need at least 190 pledges.

The Shoes

RD S.K.U. BEAST


RD Tee

Help Grow by Sharing

We look forward to growing our brand and hope that all those who cross fit, cross train and play basketball can share this to their networks.

We appreciate you.

story:
A bottle of wine is often the go-to hostess gift...

It's easy to buy, available at a variety of price points, and who doesn't appreciate a bottle of wine?!  While all of those things are great, do you ever think it makes you look lazy or that it was an after thought?



The Wine bag with glass markers solve this problem!  It allows you to give that accessible, delicious bottle of wine with an added twist to help elevate and personalize your gift. 

You can get these and other NOD products before they go to retail through our perks!

How Can You Help?

In order to expand our distribution we need to bring in more inventory to fulfill the demand.  We are looking for $100,000 in funding and you can help!  We are offering you exclusive perks for helping us achieve our goal!

4 unique wine bags with glass markers!

8 everyday designs of our wine bags with glass markers! 

8 everyday designs of our wine bags with glass markers, 

2- 6 piece glass marker sets

2- 6 piece party pick sets

8 of our everyday wine bag designs

5 sets of wine markers

4 sets of party picks 

3 in 1 Chill Bar!

Take care of your Winter Holiday shopping early with the Holiday Collection Perk!
All items in this perk have Holiday themed designs!

4 Wine Bag's with Glass Markers 

2- Wine glass markers 

(6) & bottle Stopper (1) set. 

2-2pc Bottle Stoppers, 

                                      8pc party picks

  4pc snowflake coasters and a bottle opener!

With the "Club Member" Tasting Perk you will receive 3 new NOD products before they "go public" in 4 different shipments.  Shipments will be sent in June '16, September '16, January '17, April '17.


With the "Club Member" Reserve  Perk you will receive 6 exclusive NOD products before they "go public" in 4 different shipments.  Shipments will be sent in June '16, September '16, January '17, April '17.


Each bag comes with 6 silicone glass markers integrated into the design of the bag.


The glass markers fit on the rim of the glass which allows them to be used on stemmed or stemless glasses.  



A variety of wine bags for any occasion!






 

   


Our NOD product line (when you look at our products you nod because they are awesome) consists of a variety of  kitchen/entertaining, fitness and electronic products generally under $10 retail!  We work with our factory partners to bring affordable, innovative products to mass market while applying our invincible blend of packaging, design and branding.

The Wine bag with Glass Markers is our newest product and we can't wait to expand our distribution!  


A portion of all proceeds from this Campaign and Create for Retail sales will be donated to The Sturge-Weber Foundation in order to help them with their mission to "improve the quality of life and care for people with Sturge-Weber syndrome and associated Port Wine Birthmark conditions through collaborative education, advocacy, research and friendly support."

To learn more about Sturge-Weber Syndrome please watch this video https://vimeo.com/161513157 visit their website!

www.sturge-weber.org

If you are not able to contribute financially we would love your help spreading the word!  Please use our link to make some noise about our campaign!


Our team at Create for Retail is passionate about creating witty, irresistible, practical products and bringing them to our customers at an attainable price. Our customers do not have to sacrifice quality, design or innovation to buy a product they can afford. 

Jenna Pugh has spent her entire career in the retail and product industry, and has experienced the field from all angles—store operations, visual merchandising, product/program development, account management, and sales. 

Caren Schweitzer founded Promotional Product Agency, Creative Resources and turned it into an industry powerhouse. She’s a driving force behind the organization’s hallmarks of delivering innovative solutions. 

Mark Waldorf is an accomplished leader with 15 years of product development and marketing experience. Mark is also the founder of OutLoud Promotions, a certified LGBTE and green-certified promotional products company. 


We’re witty people with witty products, but we’re stone cold serious when it comes to ethical business practices and delivering above and beyond expectations for our customers.


Here’s more about what we stand for:

We’ve found a way to combine newness, quality, affordability, and speed to market. In our industry, that’s wizard-level performance, and it’s a standard we hold ourselves to every day.

It’s not just customers who keep coming back to us. We’ve made so many good friends in the industry, you’d think we were handing out lottery tickets and candy. (Spoiler: We’re not. We’re just really good to work with.) We value strong partnerships with people who are as trustworthy and hard-working as we are.

We create unexpected bright spots in people’s lives, and that’s what keeps us going every day. People smile just by looking at our products, and when they take them home, that feeling spreads to their families, friends, and party guests. How fun is that?!

Our products are all about the details, but when it comes to strategy, we are big-picture people. We’re constantly thinking ahead and developing new and innovative ways to captivate and delight the mass market.



We are a Women Owned, WBENC certified company and are committed to acting intentionally by working with other diverse companies.  


THANK YOU!

story: My name is Dani Merritt. I launched Elusion Clothing in 2006. I was broke and pregnant at the time. My dream was to make clothing for men, so I started with t-shirts. I was able to get local dj's to start wearing my shirts to their club events, getting attention. Sales began to pour in. From there, we received a small investment, ordering more shirts, giving a few away to important people in our city. We have been in business sine June of 2006. We have expanded into much more, with a range of sizes from XS - 4XL. We want to expand into denim this fall, having inventory for our bigger clientele. We do sell to a ton of professional athletes, with larger thighs, making it hard for them to find the right sized clothing. We want to be the go to brand for the guys that cannot find their fit. We also pride ourselves on giving back. We donate leftover shirts, returned items and we also help young men in our hometown with job interview attire, etiquette and much more. I want this brand to be about more than clothing. I truly want men to feel and look their absolute best, no matter what.
