story:
HOUKIE SKATEBOARD SHOE PROTECTOR

SAVE $$ ON SKATEBOARDING SHOES !!

 Tired of wasting money on new skate shoes??

 Problem solved!! (and cool to wear too!!) 


This is a flexible overshoe that will protect all areas where damage occurs when skateboarding.  It is a "one-size fits all" shoecover. ( This will be  made to fit men's size 6 to 12 - Youth sizes will be created after the initial launch of the men's size) The dynamic stretch bands at the midfoot allows the cover the stretch to fit numerous sizes. The Houkie is stylish, removable and reusable.   Hopefully will launch in February 2016!!  

The actual product will be injection molded rubber and in many different colors and looks. The above photo is just a rendering.   The product will not be bulky (approx 1/16th of an inch thick) and will allow the skater to keep the "board feel" that is of utmost importance!  

Here is a digital rendered image of what the HOUKIE will look like on a skate shoe...



Skateboarding has progressed from casually riding on a skateboard to stunts, tricks and maneuvering the skateboard in many ways such as kicks, flips, jumps, spins.....etc. This new maneuvering and riding of the skateboard has been known to cause excessive and severe damage to many areas of the rider's shoes due to the surface that the rider is on, and the manipulation of the skateboard with the rider's feet. On the top of the skateboard is "grip tape" which is essentially sandpaper. This grip tape, when it comes in comes in contact with the skateboarder's shoe during the tricks and maneuvers, adds traction to the shoe in order for the rider to perform the tricks. This grip tape also causes tearing and major wear to several areas of the shoe. The main areas of the shoe that is affected are the outside upper of the shoe, the laces of the shoe, the ball area of the sole as well as the heel and heel area of the sole. In addition, the soles of the rider's shoe is susceptible to wear from the grip tape and the hard surfaces on which the rider is skating on when his is riding and performing these tricks and stunts, for example: concrete, blacktop, hardwood etc. Within a short time, the skateboarder has worn his shoe down so much that he will need to replace the shoe because it is no longer usable or safe to use. In this day and age, a skate shoe can range in cost from $40 to over $100 per pair.



The current products on the market provide some protection of the upper portion of the shoe, but not to the bottom of the shoe. These "patches" are affixed to the shoe with adhesive glues or other types of adhesive means. Additional prior art shows a product that protects the front area of the shoe. Another product is a type of glue or rubber cement that is applied to the area of the upper portion of the shoe that dries to form a barrier where the wear is prevalent.




The current products as stated above are semi-permanent fixes that are mostly not removable from the shoe. These products, such as the adhesive patches, cannot be removed once applied and do not last very long. They do not allow the skateboarder to wear it for any other use than to skateboard since the shoe is altered and not very visually appealing. They do not protect all areas of the shoe where damage and wear is prevalent. The glue/rubber cement product also is not removable once applied. This product takes time to dry before the rider can wear the shoes to skateboard. Although it can be placed on most areas where the damage is prevalent, It is very messy and does not provide the best protection. It is a very temporary fix to the problem. These products are not removable nor are they reusable. Other products that may be found in prior art are made to be applied due to the size of the shoe and need to be purchased using the shoe size specifically or a small range of sizes.


Feel free to ask any questions about the Houkie. The money raised will be used for the first run from the manufacturer and additional testing. We hope to have the product to market for sale in February 2016.


Risks and challenges

The risks involved here are minimal. Production will start December 2015 as we have located the factory to produce them. We will test the first samples and get the material choice perfect. Then it off to the shelves of shops and stores everywhere.
story_txt:
HOUKIE SKATEBOARD SHOE PROTECTORSAVE $$ ON SKATEBOARDING SHOES !! Tired of wasting money on new skate shoes?? Problem solved!! (and cool to wear too!!) This is a flexible overshoe that will protect all areas where damage occurs when skateboarding.  It is a "one-size fits all" shoecover. ( This will be  made to fit men's size 6 to 12 - Youth sizes will be created after the initial launch of the men's size) The dynamic stretch bands at the midfoot allows the cover the stretch to fit numerous sizes. The Houkie is stylish, removable and reusable.   Hopefully will launch in February 2016!!  The actual product will be injection molded rubber and in many different colors and looks. The above photo is just a rendering.   The product will not be bulky (approx 1/16th of an inch thick) and will allow the skater to keep the "board feel" that is of utmost importance!  Here is a digital rendered image of what the HOUKIE will look like on a skate shoe...

Skateboarding has progressed from casually riding on a skateboard to stunts, tricks and maneuvering the skateboard in many ways such as kicks, flips, jumps, spins.....etc. This new maneuvering and riding of the skateboard has been known to cause excessive and severe damage to many areas of the rider's shoes due to the surface that the rider is on, and the manipulation of the skateboard with the rider's feet. On the top of the skateboard is "grip tape" which is essentially sandpaper. This grip tape, when it comes in comes in contact with the skateboarder's shoe during the tricks and maneuvers, adds traction to the shoe in order for the rider to perform the tricks. This grip tape also causes tearing and major wear to several areas of the shoe. The main areas of the shoe that is affected are the outside upper of the shoe, the laces of the shoe, the ball area of the sole as well as the heel and heel area of the sole. In addition, the soles of the rider's shoe is susceptible to wear from the grip tape and the hard surfaces on which the rider is skating on when his is riding and performing these tricks and stunts, for example: concrete, blacktop, hardwood etc. Within a short time, the skateboarder has worn his shoe down so much that he will need to replace the shoe because it is no longer usable or safe to use. In this day and age, a skate shoe can range in cost from $40 to over $100 per pair.





The current products on the market provide some protection of the upper portion of the shoe, but not to the bottom of the shoe. These "patches" are affixed to the shoe with adhesive glues or other types of adhesive means. Additional prior art shows a product that protects the front area of the shoe. Another product is a type of glue or rubber cement that is applied to the area of the upper portion of the shoe that dries to form a barrier where the wear is prevalent.









The current products as stated above are semi-permanent fixes that are mostly not removable from the shoe. These products, such as the adhesive patches, cannot be removed once applied and do not last very long. They do not allow the skateboarder to wear it for any other use than to skateboard since the shoe is altered and not very visually appealing. They do not protect all areas of the shoe where damage and wear is prevalent. The glue/rubber cement product also is not removable once applied. This product takes time to dry before the rider can wear the shoes to skateboard. Although it can be placed on most areas where the damage is prevalent, It is very messy and does not provide the best protection. It is a very temporary fix to the problem. These products are not removable nor are they reusable. Other products that may be found in prior art are made to be applied due to the size of the shoe and need to be purchased using the shoe size specifically or a small range of sizes.




The HOUKIE is a removable and reusable flexible overshoe that is placed over the shoe which will cover all areas of the shoe that are damaged during skateboarding. This overshoe is made of a flexible material that conforms to the shoe in all areas needed in order to protect specific portions of the shoe while conforming to the shoe's shape. This can be one piece or a combination of pieces to create the overshoe. The overshoe adds additional cushioning and traction to the heel and ball of the shoe. The middle of the overshoe is constructed in a way to allow the overshoe to be stretched to fit and conform to a very broad range of shoe sizes and not just to a few size ranges. The upper and the sole also has added traction in the form of raised areas or other forms of traction to allow the "grip" of the shoe to the skateboard for the efficient execution of tricks and stunts. The overshoe also covers the laces area on the front of the shoe protecting them from damage where it is prevalent. Once the skateboarder has finished using the product, it can be removed and saved to be reused at a later time. The construction of this overshoe is such that it can be used on any type of shoe therefore making any shoe style a "skateboarding" shoe.  There is also areas of the HOUKIE that will allow  for different company logos who wish to sponsor or license the product.


We are hoping to have the Houkie last over 4 months so this will save tons of $$ on shoes. We are researching different materials that will be flexible but durable enough in addition to keeping the "board feel" for the skateboarder.Feel free to ask any questions about the Houkie. The money raised will be used for the first run from the manufacturer and additional testing. We hope to have the product to market for sale in February 2016.

Risks and challengesThe risks involved here are minimal. Production will start December 2015 as we have located the factory to produce them. We will test the first samples and get the material choice perfect. Then it off to the shelves of shops and stores everywhere.

story:
Welcome!

What I am trying to do is create an awesome set of coasters that is simple with a bold look that will look great in any home, and something you'll absolutley love the entire time you use it. They're wonderful to keep or give as a gift.

Each coaster is handmade by me from scratch. I look for rope that has a nice color to it and great texture. Each piece is glued and spiraled by hand and then sprayed with a water repellent coating to keep liquids from absorbing and for the coaster to last longer. Dont worry if you have a very icey beverage though, the rings of rope hold the condensation in its grooves to prevent liquid from getting onto any surface you're trying to protect.  

About me

I am a young entrepreneur that loves to make people happy through my crafts. I like creating different projects and dream of selling them and starting my own business. My goal is to start that here on Indiegogo. I've been doing handmade crafts for as long as I remember and always take pride in my work. I don't take short cuts and make sure I create quality peices every single time.

Why I need YOU

This project can not be completed without the generous support of the Indiegogo community and people like you. The money gathered from this project would go to purchasing materials, labor, shipping charges, and fees from Indiegogo. If there was any remander money, I would love to put that back into my goal of creating a business by making even more projects to sell. If this project goes well I have many more ideas that I would love to start here on Indiegogo. A few on the way are handmade bowls and pens. NONE of this would be possible without your support, so please pledge and get a pack of wonderful handmade rope coaster! Thank you all so much and please share this campaign!

                                                              
                                                         PERKS!

Free U.S. shipping on ALL perks! And guaranteed delivery before Christmas

1$ or more

THANK YOU! THANK YOU! 
Every contribution, no matter the size, means the world to me. You'll get all the updates about this project and see how much it can grow.

10$ or more

YOU ARE AMAZING. 
So amazing, I'll even create my first ever twitter account just to follow you and give a shout out. I'll also send you a personal message in the mail with a lot of love and a big thank you! You'll be kept up on all progress for this project.

25$ or more: EARLY BIRD

You will recieve a set or 4 handmade rope coasters! Also a personal message, project updates, follow you on twitter and a shout out.

30$ or more: Rope Package

You will recieve a set or 4 handmade rope coasters! Also a personal message, project updates, follow you on twitter and a shout out.

55$ or more: EARLY BIRD: Double Rope Package

You'll get 8 hand made rope coasters! Keep all 8 for yourself or give a pack as a gift. You'll also get a personal message from me, project updates, I'll follow you on twitter and give you a shout out.

60$ or more: Double Rope Package

You'll get 8 hand made rope coasters! Keep all 8 for yourself or give a pack as a gift. You'll also get a personal message from me, project updates, I'll follow you on twitter and give you a shout out.

85$ or more: Giant Triple Rope Package

The best of the best. You'll get 12 sweet rope coasters to keep for yourself or share as gifts. Along with this you'll get a personal message with my gratitude, project updates, I'll follow you on twitter and give you a shout out.


                                                    Risks and challenges

My project is straight forward and I don't see many obstacles that would get in my way. The biggest challenge I could face is if I get an overly large amount of orders and it takes a little bit longer to fulfill the rewards. To fix this I've given myself a large amount of time to fulfill all orders so they'll be on time or even possibly early so people can get their gifts by Christmas and enjoy their rewards.

story:
"We are creating functional, sustainable, ethical, organic clothing with meticulous design. Most importantly 10% of all profits will be donated to charities that mitigate human and environment affliction in the fashion industry." -D-RIGINAL-L

 

References: 1 - 2 - 3 - 4

D-RIGINAL-L, Originally Tailored.

Hello, I am David. I am the founder and CEO of D-RIGINAL-L and to help fund the growth of the company and provide more ethically made and functional clothes to you, we are asking for your help. The fashion industry is dominated by fast fashion companies who are able to produce very cheap fashion items at a very quick pace, with that being said many cotton clothes produced by these companies contain a very large volume of pesticides, which damages not only the environment but also the workers using it.

D-RIGINAL-L is not setting out to be another clothing company that sells unsustainable clothes or uses sweatshops to keep cost down just to  maximise profits. We don't concentrating everything on making a profit. Human rights, workers rights, and the environment is at the forefront of what we do. Helps us deliver positive change in the fashion industry.  

D-RIGINAL-L deeply believes that the continuous environment damage caused by unethical fashion brands and the exploitation of people has to be abolished. Workers deserve a good working condition and be paid a wage that allows them to live life with dignity. With your support we can fight the negative effects being caused in the fashion industry and we are donating 10% of all profits to Labour Behind the Label. If you value people over profit, please lend us your support.

D-RIGINAL-L will be producing clothing on a print - on - demand basis, this means the clothes will be made to order resulting in zero-waste.

D-RIGINAL-L uses Earth Positive Clothing. They are renowned as one of the leaders in the global garment industry for sustainable clothing production. For more information about earth positive click here. 

 

You have probably heard this cliché, the reason why so many business fail is due to lack of funding. D-RIGINAL-L is using the indiegogo crowdfunding platform, to test to see if people are keen to back us by supporting with their money. 

Why £15,000?

D-RIGINAL-L aims to be at the forefront of functional wear. We are in contact with various suppliers and development teams around the world to attain ethical and sustainable materials for our products. We want to offer you a solution that most major fashion brands are not offering; sweatshop free, organic, functional clothes at an affordable price. 

Majority of our cost is attributed to the material and workmanship that goes into our clothing. Without your support, it would be impossible for us to offer the world functional clothes that not only looks after the people who make it but the environment too. Every single support goes a long way. By simply liking our Facebook, Instagram, or tweeting about us, your contributing by bringing us a step closer to changing the destructive aspects being practiced in the fashion industry. 

Please support us in trying to make this work!
We’ve brought together cutting edge design using inspiration from the environment, graphic design, street and much more to create some truly fascinating designs.

Without further adore, take a look for yourself...

 

 

ATHLETICS 
The D-RIGINAL-L Athletics is a T-shirt, perfected with organic cotton for lightweight manoeuvre and comfort. 

 

ELE PRINT 
The D-RIGINAL-L Ele Print features an elephant graphic for a modern spin on a classic box logo profile. The colourful outline allows you to rock the T-shirt with any outfit.

LIFESTYLE 
The D-RIGINAL-L "Lifestyle" T-shirt is made with soft organic cotton for everyday comfort and durability. 

 

CLASSIC 
The D-RIGINAL-L Classic T-shirt features a signature graphics on soft organic cotton for everyday comfort and durability. 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

Q: What is crowdfunding?

A: Crowdfunding is a method of raising money, awareness and support for great ideas by asking a large number of people each for a small amount of money.

Q: What do I get for my money?

A: For the money you pledge you will receive a reward-

The reward section explaining what you will receive for each different cost is a short scroll up from this.

Q: How do I purchase or pledge your clothes?

A: You can do so by selecting the Perk side bar, which is located on the right hand side (scroll up). Select the Perk of your choice and you will be directed to a page to fill in your detail in order to complete the transaction.

Q: When do I select my colour and sizes as well as my shipping address?

A: When we achieve our campaign goals, we will send you a form fill up. The form will include size, colour and design for each tank, vest, and t-shirt.

Q: When can I expect delivery for my pledge?

A: We are unsure of how much support we will get from this campaign but we aim to get the products out as quickly as possible, the date we have set is December 2016.

Q: Is there a return policy?

A: Unless the product is delivered faulty or broken we will be unable to process returns at this current stage in the formation of the company. Our garments are made to order and we have sizing below to ensure you get the right fit.

Q: Do you have a sizing chart?

A: Yes, please take a look below.

Any other question?

Please get in touch, we are happy to help :)

 

We have the images of the products above so you can see the exact style of clothing we will be using. Some of the items of clothing presented above may not be a 100% accurate representation of the clothing when they are printed. All of our clothes use organic cotton. We have tried our best to ensure our products come from responsible suppliers as can be seen in the HOW section above. If there is something that you feel is not in line with our campaign, please contact us we would love to hear feedback so we can make this company as eco-friendly and ethical as possible.

story:
MISS TANGLES is the first customizable brush that removes knots and tangles, taking care of your hair by avoiding painful pulling and breakage with smooth and effortless brushing.

Our brushes are manufactured with MEMORYFLEX, a technology that makes it easier for the bristle to flex and go back to its original position, minimizing the breakage and loss of hair.

The gel bristles, placed in three different levels, detangle your hair from the root to the tips in a soft and smooth way. Its strokes flex just the right amount to detangle your hair before any tugs or breakages. Our lovely brushes MISS TANGLES allow a perfect brushing either for dry or wet hair, straight or wavy. These products are protected and patented.

Through many hours of research and consulting with people in the know, we are super proud of the formula we have which achieves the hold, durability and versatility of MISS TANGLES. Our material composition is what sets us apart from other similar products on the market and achieves the goal we set out to achieve.

We at MISS TANGLES became interested in the idea for detangling hairbrush when we set about creating a brush that would make daily brushing a more pleasant experience and less damaging to hair. Combining creativity and innovative thinking we came up with this brush. So, after careful research and countless brainstorming sessions, MISS TANGLES was born.

Initially, we sketched out our varied designs and concluded that our circular shape be the most practical shapes, in addition to defining our unique brand. The next step was to turn to 3D modelling software and concept rendering to gain a better feel on the perfect dimensions required as well as the visual appeal of the final product.

We knew the material composition of MISS TANGLES would be crucial to its success, so we turned to expert help to guide us in specifying the required materials and as a result are extremely happy with the results of MISS TANGLES. (Watch our Video for examples!)

Finally, we had to find a quality manufacturer that would follow the same High Quality Standards that we believe in. We are pleased to say we have found our manufacturer and are ready to proceed with final production. (Watch our Video)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HocGEZYgLrM

MISS TANGLES can be customized on-line:

www.misstangles.com

Discover how you can design your own brush HERE!!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zyHEHRnHH0Q

 

 
After doing countless hours of research and development to create a worthy Gel Bristles, we now need the support of the community to help bring our project to life.
 
Our funding goal will help us to secure all the initial supplies, materials and production costs, as well as cover initial marketing and distribution costs to bring MISS TANGLES to the market. You can help us today by pledging, every dollar counts!
story_txt: MISS TANGLES is the first customizable brush that removes knots and tangles, taking care of your hair by avoiding painful pulling and breakage with smooth and effortless brushing.Our brushes are manufactured with MEMORYFLEX, a technology that makes it easier for the bristle to flex and go back to its original position, minimizing the breakage and loss of hair.The gel bristles, placed in three different levels, detangle your hair from the root to the tips in a soft and smooth way. Its strokes flex just the right amount to detangle your hair before any tugs or breakages. Our lovely brushes MISS TANGLES allow a perfect brushing either for dry or wet hair, straight or wavy. These products are protected and patented.Through many hours of research and consulting with people in the know, we are super proud of the formula we have which achieves the hold, durability and versatility of MISS TANGLES. Our material composition is what sets us apart from other similar products on the market and achieves the goal we set out to achieve.We at MISS TANGLES became interested in the idea for detangling hairbrush when we set about creating a brush that would make daily brushing a more pleasant experience and less damaging to hair. Combining creativity and innovative thinking we came up with this brush. So, after careful research and countless brainstorming sessions, MISS TANGLES was born.Initially, we sketched out our varied designs and concluded that our circular shape be the most practical shapes, in addition to defining our unique brand. The next step was to turn to 3D modelling software and concept rendering to gain a better feel on the perfect dimensions required as well as the visual appeal of the final product.We knew the material composition of MISS TANGLES would be crucial to its success, so we turned to expert help to guide us in specifying the required materials and as a result are extremely happy with the results of MISS TANGLES. (Watch our Video for examples!)Finally, we had to find a quality manufacturer that would follow the same High Quality Standards that we believe in. We are pleased to say we have found our manufacturer and are ready to proceed with final production. (Watch our Video)https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HocGEZYgLrMMISS TANGLES can be customized on-line:www.misstangles.comDiscover how you can design your own brush HERE!!https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zyHEHRnHH0Q  After doing countless hours of research and development to create a worthy Gel Bristles, we now need the support of the community to help bring our project to life. Our funding goal will help us to secure all the initial supplies, materials and production costs, as well as cover initial marketing and distribution costs to bring MISS TANGLES to the market. You can help us today by pledging, every dollar counts!

story:
Ø envisions a brand that expands cultural boundaries of acceptance. we believe in preservation and conservation as foundation for a business model. we have developed an integrated entrepreneurial model for US apparel makers that has both domestic and foreign enterprise and that remakes and makes new apparel and fine art in zero waste processes.

it is our goal to position our brand and business sustainably in this new market economy of post consumer waste (repurposing & up-cyling).  it is our honor to contribute to the sustainable living of women through our life work project.

life work project: we partner with Beloved Atlanta, to provide advocacy and work development programs to help rehabilitate victimized women. 20% of our work force development is dedicated to helping women move into rehabilitated sustainable lives. we pay a living wage. this is reflected in our prices and in the quality of our work-woman-ship. we believe in living life with fewer things of greater value.

to contribute to the reduction of the massive amount of textile waste (11-13 million tons) per year:

  • by up-cycling used textile pieces and 2nd hand clothing into beautiful new garments. 
  • by making new garments in a significantly low textile waste process.
  • by engaging highly skilled designers and stitch artists who embrace our life work project. 

Ø upcycle: is made atelier (fashion work shop) style. we make our founding pieces (Ø archive) like  a classic paris atelier, except that, we use waste from each cut as either a body part or adornment in the following pieces until the waste is used. any final waste goes into quilts, given to artists as raw materials, or into local hand made paper.  our aesthetic or style is visually stunning.

the work-woman-ship and style of our pieces is like nothing you have ever seen in luxury fashion. this we promise. we strive for originality and creativity in our work, executed with an elevated sense of cut, silhouette and embellishment. our upcycle making process is primarily artisanal and made in our atlanta work studio. we do however contract small batches of our tee shirts, gender free shirts and the denim series jackets.  

 

in our knitwear products we use the finest cotton fiber and yarn available on the planet. it is exquisitely soft and luxurious.

Ø  has been in development for nearly 5 years.  it started  with a 25-year-old collection of fashion artifacts globally collected by the founder, karen glass. 

"after working in the textile and apparel business for over 30 years,  i began to become acutely aware of all of the textile and garment waste i had personally been accountable for, by either sitting at a sewing machine making 1,000,000 pairs of men's underwear in a year and half, or by directing the product teams of well know apparel companies. i can remember seeing clothes i had been personally accountable to make everywhere, from the local thrift store, to a rag in someone's trash or in the street in an alleyway while in paris. this led me to begin the development of zero waste apparel making through an up-cycle design and make process i could do here in the US and through working with a factory in nepal to develop knitwear in a socially compliant, zero waste (0.05%) process. i was looking to work with yarn companies that were 100% traceable back to fiber. my vision was to find the best possible quality of cotton yarn on the planet. plus it needed to be either 100% GOTS certified  and/or 100% traceable back to growing source. GOTS (global organic textile standard) is the gold standard for organic, globally sourced and made fiber, garments and factories.  i worked with the factory in nepal to become certified GOTS experienced and to acquire national social compliance for their factory and workers.”

Ø archive: global textile artifacts are transformed into one of a kind new pieces. our first series was made from an old obi cloth made in shanghai, circa 1930s. these are our limited addition, highly luxurious pieces, mostly hand stitched. these pieces are our crown jewel. our archive process involves cutting the first piece from the bulk of the artifact, and then using the remnants to adorn the 2nd piece, and the remnants from that go into a 3rd piece etc, until all of the remnants are used up.  any leftovers that are unusable go into fine art, or into local paper making. we offer them ready to wear and as a bespoke service. these pieces define the brand in provenance, style and process. moving forward, we will be making them in a series with a size range from xs-xl, but each will have unique design nuances due to the raw materials used. the retail range is from $2600 to $4500. we are also adding a denim archive jacket that will retail at $1000. the denim jackets will be made in small batch production in new york city.

Ø 2: menswear transformed into  beautiful feminine pieces. from factory waste or thrift stores, remade and adorned with contemporary detailing of found textile objects and exceptional hand and machine stitch work. we consider our stitch work to be unique and signature to our brand. 

Ø knit: is our lifestyle line of fully-fashioned knitwear in modern silhouettes that transition through daily activity. this line speaks directly to our design and brand philosophy of living life with fewer things (clothes) of greater value. we buy yarn spun in italy because it can be done no where else on the planet as finely as italians do. we looked for a fiber that equals sea isle cotton ( the finest cotton fiber available) or bested it. we found this with cariaggi's belize cotton. it is the finest 2/80 yarn count cotton ever sourced.  karen has seen 10's of 1000's of yarn qualities in her career and has found the cariaggi 2/80 to be the most exquisite. we pair this luxurious 2/80 with a fine long staple grown in india within GOTS certified protocol in a 2/50 yarn count with an equally luxurious hand feel, but is a more durable and full bodied yarn for lower body pieces. we make our knitwear in nepal because we believe in contributing to a developing nation's economy as much as we do to that of our own country.

we are looking to raise $190,000 with this campaign. the founder, karen glass, has invested $100,000 +. she believes in the beauty & purpose of this work. 

your contribution now to our campaign will give us the funding we need to:

  • stay in our work studio and build inventory
  • rebuild our website for e commerce
  • spread the word of our purpose through marketing channels with  an incredible PR and marketing woman (who is currently working for free!)
  • keep building our upcycle inventory (Ø archive & Ø 2)
  •  buy yarn for our Ø knit line and begin to produce inventory
  • pay our small team of practictioners: designers, stitch artists & apprentices (our beloved women)

  • scale up our work studio by adding more practitioners to produce more inventory and add more product lines, such as accessories and footwear
  • establish a retail presence through pop ups in new york, chicago and miami
  • establish a selected wholesale presence in major metropolitan areas
  • build our online presence with a unique digital experience through innovative technology

we want to start selling product in spring 2017. this means ordering yarn for the nepal production by november 1. as soon as we receive funding, we will buy yarn and scale up our Ø archive and Ø 2 production to full-time. we are confident to be able to present a solid business plan to our microcosm of fine potential investors that calls for an initial round of funding of $800,000. our goal is to gross $1.5 mil year one and show a promising but very modest profit.  we plan to do 20% of our business in pop up retail in nyc. 40% e-commerce and 40% wholesale. 

  • completed all 2017 prototypes and processes and are in production in Ø archive & Ø 2.
  • in pre-production for Ø knit, awaiting yarn supply
  • have a working design, development & production model for both upcycle product in atlanta and new product in nepal.
  • integrated the life work project partnership with beloved atlanta into our upcycle work process with an apprentice program for women looking to work in the apparel making industry
  • CREATIVE LOAFING MAGAZINE designer of the year 2016
  • Modern Atlanta featured designer
  • Atlanta Magazine
  • Goat Farm Arts Centet Concept retail space- Installation
  • in addition to Ø, karen glass has successfully built other brands from scratch for other companies, and rebuilt brands from failing positions. karen has extensive experience in designing and managing apparel production techniques and processes globally, and is now putting her intention and energy into Ø.

social, economic, and environmental concerns and engagement are rapidly becoming a global mainstream ideology that is driving a growing economic sector. we believe change is crucial.  Ø imagines and enacts a more sustainable future for industry and community. with our Ø knit line, we impact industrial waste by bringing the typical industry standard of  approximately 15% waste to 0.05% waste. we reduce post consumer waste by up cycling it into new apparel. in addition to reducing textile waste on a global scale, the Ø process is a unique approach that can be taught to entrepreneurial designers. we contribute to the sustainable and secure living of women. we are a model for local enterprise that does business globally.

the fashion business is risky and competitive. to get exposure, a brand must stand out. in addition to securing the finances to build our company into a sustainable, self-supporting enterprise, exceptional marketing and outreach will be one of our most important efforts. we are increasing our marketing budget to 2.5 times what we originally considered to amplify our exposure and get the word out about our brand and its purpose.

another challenge is finding highly skilled fashion designers and apparel makers. we have created a modular system of design-and-make that includes an apprenticeship to train individuals in the art and making of fashion apparel. we will also contract out our Ø 2 t-shirt processing and our small-batch Ø archive jackets in atlanta and in new york city. we are also beginning an outreach to colleges to develop curriculum that teaches entrepreneurial design and process.

if you are unable to contribute to our campaign financially, there are plenty of other ways to help. we appreciate any energy you are able to contribute. for us, that means living life more consciously. being mindful of waste not just as stuff, but of thought as well. reduce your 60,000 thoughts a day. live life with fewer things of greater value. have fewer thoughts of greater, more transcendent value. make giving a part of your life. human time translates into human value. help us do good by doing good. help us create movement in the world.

and please share this campaign with everyone who has an ear to listen, and a voice.

story:
"DIY FERTILITY BOOST...FROM THE 'LAB IN A MATCHBOX'"

 

„BABY HOME KIT“ SOLL DEN KINDERWUNSCH PER DO-IT-YOURSELF-PRINZIP ERFÜLLEN - GANZ OHNE KLINIK

 

 

 

 

 

 

Dropping the price of assisted reproduction from $500-$5000 per treatment to $50 is a radical innovation and the logical question is: how is this possible? Especially considering that assisted reproduction has been around for about 40 years.

The key to the answer is sperm preparation. In order to perform a simple assisted reproduction procedure called Intrauterine Insemination (IUI), sperm must be purified. Until now, only fertility clinics were able to purify sperm using centrifuges in their labs. But we have a viable alternative to the current procedure with our patented Baby Home Kit device:


The Baby Home Kit device provides a safe and natural sperm preparation method and it enables us to offer assisted reproduction at home for the first time in history. The device has an intricate and sophisticated network of channels and layers through which the sperm must swim up and through. The end result being that purified sperm ends up in the outlet channel from where they can be extracted and used for IUI at home.

 

 

 

The fertility treatment industry has for most of its history focused more on the female side of the equation. Dr. Marion Vollmer, the inventor of the Baby Home Kit, started her research by examining the male side of the equation. With 30% of fertility issues attributable to the male, and 30% more being unknown, it made sense to start with the sperm.

Dr. Vollmer's initial research at the University of Toronto focused on state-of-the-art microfluidic technologies which have only been available for the last several years. Combining her own expertise in biomedical science and sperm swimming behavior with microfluidic design and engineering technology led to the creation of the Baby Home Kit device. Some of her scientific findings are shown below:

 

 

 

 

The Baby Home Kit enables you to perform Intrauterine Insemination (IUI), a standard procedure commonly used in fertility clinics. The procedure involves a simple 3-step process that takes less than an hour:

  1. Collect a small amount of semen using the beaker.
  2. Perform sperm preparation with the Baby Home Kit device.
  3. Inject sperm into the uterus of the women.

As shown below, the Kit includes everything you need to do this:

 

 

 

 

For photos of the perks, see the image gallery at the top of this page.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

We are super-social. Follow us here and help us spread the word:

 

         

 

...and don't forget to mention

#BabyMakingHistory

 

 

In addition to the answers here in the FAQ section, we prepared some videos for you in which Marion explains a little bit more about the Kit and its history. However, if there are still open questions please don't hesitate to contact Marion directly at marion@babyhomekit.com.

 

  1. Where can I buy the Baby Home Kit?

The Baby Home Kit will only be pre-sold here on Indiegogo, even after the campaign is over. 

 

  1. How will you use the money you collect on Indiegogo?

We have been working on the Baby Home Kit for several years and, so far, we are a self-financed startup company. However, the Baby Home Kit, and specifically the Baby Home Kit device, is considered a medical device and will thus need some further clinical testing and regulatory approval. The money raised on Indiegogo will be spent for the manufacturing of high-quality prototypes which will be tested in the clinics.

 

  1. Why should I buy the Baby Home Kit now and not just when it is on the market?

The Baby Home Kit is still in development and we need some financial help to get it to market. So every pre-sold kit will help us make the dream happen of providing affordable, do-it-yourself, assisted reproduction. 

 

  1. When will you deliver the Baby Home Kit?

The anticipated date for shipping will be 2018.

 

  1. What does the Baby Home Kit include?

The Baby Home Kit includes everything you need to purify sperm and perform Intrauterine Insemination at home. This includes a beaker for semen collection, our Baby Home Kit device including two syringes for loading and extracting the sample, a speculum and an insemination catheter. To keep everything sterile it also includes sterile gloves. We also highly recommend using the free Baby Home App which provides training and support on the procedure.

 

  1. Will it really work?

The sperm preparation technology included in the Baby Home Kit is based on the latest research in sperm swimming. A precursor of the Baby Home Kit device has proven to be high-performing in sperm purification and similar results are expected for the Baby Home Kit device in upcoming clinical testing. If you are interested in more of the scientific details, read the following publications by Dr. Marion Vollmer, inventor of the Baby Home Kit:

 

1. Nosrati R, Vollmer M, Eamer L, San Gabriel MC, Zeidan K, Zini A, Sinton D. (2014). Rapid selection of sperm with high DNA integrity. Lab Chip. 14(6):1142-50.

 

2. Eamer L, Vollmer M, Nosrati R, San Gabriel MC, Zeidan K, Zini A,Sinton D. (2016). Turning the corner in fertility: high DNA integrity of boundary-following sperm. Lab Chip. 16(13):2418-22.

 

  1. Is it safe?

Intrauterine Insemination is a standard procedure commonly used in the fertility clinics. Our Baby Home Kit device ensures that sperm are purified, so that the injection of sperm into the uterus is safe. However, it is absolutely crucial to keep everything sterile during sperm preparation and insemination. We will provide you with the required training and support to make it possible for you to perform the procedure in a safe way.

 

  1. Are there side effects?

After insemination the woman might experience some cramping which is also frequently observed in the clinics and is nothing to be concerned about most of the time. We will, however, provide more information about that in our educational material. 

 

  1. Is there training and support?

The Baby Home App has complete video training, extensive documentation and easy access to support just in case you need additional help.

 

  1. How often can I use each Baby Home Kit?

Each Baby Home Kit can only be used once since the components have to be sterile.

 

  1. I am too scared to perform the procedure at home, what should I do?

If you are not comfortable with performing the procedure at home, you always have the option to ask a medical professional to perform it for you. In the United States, it is quite common for midwives to perform IUI, so don’t hesitate to ask your midwife, your OB or your GP about it.

 

  1. Can the Baby Home Kit be used for all types of infertility?

Unfortunately, no. The Baby Home Kit device separates sperm based on their motility, so that semen samples with low motility sperm or too low sperm counts cannot be processed with the device. Also, specific female conditions, e.g. PCOS, require that a more sophisticated treatment in the clinics is performed. 

 

  1. How often can I perform assisted reproduction with the Baby Home Kit?

There is no limitation in terms of the numbers of procedures you can perform with the Baby Home Kit, as long as you use a new and sterile Baby Home Kit each time.

 

  1. Will the Baby Home Kit replace fertility clinics?

The Baby Home Kit allows you to perform Intrauterine Insemination, the most basic procedure in assisted reproduction that, in many countries, is often the first choice in the clinics. Our vision is to give all couples worldwide access to this kind of treatment, but also, we want the Baby Home Kit to help fertility clinics free up their time and help more couples who need more sophisticated treatments like IVF and ICSI.

Perform sperm preparation with the Baby Home Kit device.
Inject sperm into the uterus of the women.
As shown below, the Kit includes everything you need to do this:    For photos of the perks, see the image gallery at the top of this page.         We are super-social. Follow us here and help us spread the word:           ...and don't forget to mention#BabyMakingHistory  In addition to the answers here in the FAQ section, we prepared some videos for you in which Marion explains a little bit more about the Kit and its history. However, if there are still open questions please don't hesitate to contact Marion directly at marion@babyhomekit.com. Where can I buy the Baby Home Kit?The Baby Home Kit will only be pre-sold here on Indiegogo, even after the campaign is over.  How will you use the money you collect on Indiegogo?We have been working on the Baby Home Kit for several years and, so far, we are a self-financed startup company. However, the Baby Home Kit, and specifically the Baby Home Kit device, is considered a medical device and will thus need some further clinical testing and regulatory approval. The money raised on Indiegogo will be spent for the manufacturing of high-quality prototypes which will be tested in the clinics. Why should I buy the Baby Home Kit now and not just when it is on the market?The Baby Home Kit is still in development and we need some financial help to get it to market. So every pre-sold kit will help us make the dream happen of providing affordable, do-it-yourself, assisted reproduction.  When will you deliver the Baby Home Kit?The anticipated date for shipping will be 2018. What does the Baby Home Kit include?The Baby Home Kit includes everything you need to purify sperm and perform Intrauterine Insemination at home. This includes a beaker for semen collection, our Baby Home Kit device including two syringes for loading and extracting the sample, a speculum and an insemination catheter. To keep everything sterile it also includes sterile gloves. We also highly recommend using the free Baby Home App which provides training and support on the procedure. Will it really work?The sperm preparation technology included in the Baby Home Kit is based on the latest research in sperm swimming. A precursor of the Baby Home Kit device has proven to be high-performing in sperm purification and similar results are expected for the Baby Home Kit device in upcoming clinical testing. If you are interested in more of the scientific details, read the following publications by Dr. Marion Vollmer, inventor of the Baby Home Kit: 1. Nosrati R, Vollmer M, Eamer L, San Gabriel MC, Zeidan K, Zini A, Sinton D. (2014). Rapid selection of sperm with high DNA integrity. Lab Chip. 14(6):1142-50. 2. Eamer L, Vollmer M, Nosrati R, San Gabriel MC, Zeidan K, Zini A,Sinton D. (2016). Turning the corner in fertility: high DNA integrity of boundary-following sperm. Lab Chip. 16(13):2418-22. Is it safe?Intrauterine Insemination is a standard procedure commonly used in the fertility clinics. Our Baby Home Kit device ensures that sperm are purified, so that the injection of sperm into the uterus is safe. However, it is absolutely crucial to keep everything sterile during sperm preparation and insemination. We will provide you with the required training and support to make it possible for you to perform the procedure in a safe way. Are there side effects?After insemination the woman might experience some cramping which is also frequently observed in the clinics and is nothing to be concerned about most of the time. We will, however, provide more information about that in our educational material.  Is there training and support?The Baby Home App has complete video training, extensive documentation and easy access to support just in case you need additional help. How often can I use each Baby Home Kit?Each Baby Home Kit can only be used once since the components have to be sterile. I am too scared to perform the procedure at home, what should I do?If you are not comfortable with performing the procedure at home, you always have the option to ask a medical professional to perform it for you. In the United States, it is quite common for midwives to perform IUI, so don’t hesitate to ask your midwife, your OB or your GP about it. Can the Baby Home Kit be used for all types of infertility?Unfortunately, no. The Baby Home Kit device separates sperm based on their motility, so that semen samples with low motility sperm or too low sperm counts cannot be processed with the device. Also, specific female conditions, e.g. PCOS, require that a more sophisticated treatment in the clinics is performed.  How often can I perform assisted reproduction with the Baby Home Kit?There is no limitation in terms of the numbers of procedures you can perform with the Baby Home Kit, as long as you use a new and sterile Baby Home Kit each time. Will the Baby Home Kit replace fertility clinics?The Baby Home Kit allows you to perform Intrauterine Insemination, the most basic procedure in assisted reproduction that, in many countries, is often the first choice in the clinics. Our vision is to give all couples worldwide access to this kind of treatment, but also, we want the Baby Home Kit to help fertility clinics free up their time and help more couples who need more sophisticated treatments like IVF and ICSI.

story:
Join the tribe | Instagram: @Psychedelic_Honey_
PsychedelicHoney.com

We are building a community dedicated to empowering ladies with self-love
& inspiring health, creativity, and adventure on the daily.
Created by a designer + lady surfer + health lover
Years of surfing and traveling as an outdoor fitness ambassador for Roxy Quiksilver, working at a yoga studio, teaching kickboxing, pilates, and on herbs & superfoods, led to the desire to craft an active lifestyle brand rooted in holistic health and happiness.
With inspiration from my bohemian upbringing in Santa Barbara, CA surrounded by music, fabric, craftsmen + surfers, a BFA from Otis College of Art, + my love for murals + design, I dove into this building a dream. 
It was while living in Kauai, I found myself moving most freely from the mountains to the sea to the yoga mat to the town always wearing the same simple sports bra under flowy tops.
But clashing, computer-generated prints, and neons didn't resonate my vintage-collecting old soul. I wanted all-day active wear in natural colors + culturally-inspired + retro prints. 


From the prints, patterns + line sheets, to the logo, mission, + video,
I’ve been hand-designing every detail to embody beauty & wellbeing from the inside out. 
Based in inspiring, active coastal mountain of Santa Barbara
Made with Love in CA.

THE FEATURES

+ simple, lasting styles
+ flattering, minimal cuts
+ 2 soft fabrics to choose from
+ hidden stretch stitching
+ product tested & fixed 3x to ensure fit
+ prints hand-designed with a love for art history

- Sporty Spice is no longer your only active option
- No plastic, zippers, grommets, or gimmicks 
- No uncomfortable, unwashable details
- No clashing computer prints or neons
- No mass production abroad
- We’re not corporate!

All the hand-designed prints for 'Bold As Love' are based on my upbringing in a bohemian warehouse of fabric, music, artists, and surfers. 


Soft, stretchy, simple styles 
You can feel comfortable throwing on and living in
Look good on the go and empowered to pursue what sparks joy in you.


It’s been a radical one year of learning, growing, and taking all the tiny steps necessary to ensure 
a brand, product, and message that truly aligns mind, body, and soul. Here is how far PH has come!

- Logo, mission, and web design | Gypsyeye.com
- Back to Otis College of Art and Design  (my alma mater Yew!) to properly learn textile design
- Found & developed relationship with the right ethical manufacturer in CA
- Sourced the softest, stretchiest, high-quality fabrics with a vintage feel
- Designed all fabric prints
- Color corrected all the fabric prints… you have no idea
- Rolls of fabric printed!
- Made patterns 
- Made samples
- Fittings
- 3 Rounds of Fixes - to get the fit just right!
- Shot & styled & edited the Look book + video
- 2 murals for local art non-profits sponsored by PH!


A little influence (and a big smile!) can go a long way.
Every donation gets us closer to establishing platform from which PH can empower ladies!
We appreciate every shared link that helps us grassroots-style spread our PH Inspired Living message:) With your support we will finally be able to release our active lifestyle fashion & journey forward:

-See our radiant hand-designed prints in rolls of fabric!
-Pattern grading
-Production samples in all sizes: Small, Medium, Large
-Fittings & adjustments to patterns
-Second round of samples to finesse the fit
-Adorable PH labels & eco hang tags
-PH hats, shirts, & stickers to fulfill our Indiegogo Perks 
-Web store development
-Our first small production run for The Bee Hive babes!
 


The rewards listed on the right are the first opportunity to shop the entire Bold As Love line!
After the campaign ends on September 24th, we'll send you a Bee Hive voucher code to use at our web store. You’ll get first dibs on pre-ordering the most inspiring swim x activewear!

+ BEE HIVE MEMBERS will get exciting, insider sneak peaks + updates!
We are aiming for December delivery when production is complete. Because manufacturing comes with inherent delays, we have estimated a timeline we can adhere to, and will communicate on our progress. 

ESTIMATED TIMELINE:
Sep - Indiegogo campaign
Oct - Custom fabric printing & Sizing
Nov - Production
Dec - Delivery

FOLLOW THE JOURNEY:
Join our mailing list at PSYCHEDELICHONEY.COM
Instagram: @Psychedelic_Honey_
Facebook.com/shoppsychedelichoney

THANK YOU<3
To my boyfriend, best friend, photographer Mikel Roberts, models Kerri, Meagan, Peyton, my dad, and everyone who has helped encourage me & shared passion for Psychedelic Honey with others:) With Love & So Much Gratitude, Katie McLean | Founder & Designer | Psychedelic Honey

story:
Hi, I'm Lance McBrayer. 

I've been a certified cosmetologist and salon owner for the last 22 years. I specialize in thick, curly and frizzy hair, and have been voted Boston’s A List Winner as Best Hair Straightener for the past 3 years in a row.  I've also been a fashion photographer for the same amount of time that I've been a hairstylist. And, I've always had a passion for fashion. I've spent 15 years, part-time, as an image consultant to countless business men, fashion show coordinators, fashion photographers, family members and friends.

I'm passionate about self-improvement, health, beauty and fashion, and all their possibilities.  Over the years, I've provided hair styling and fashion styling services that help improve, inform and initiate a desire for individuals to up-grade their own personal style and self-worth. My motto is that if you "change your hair and/or your look – you change your life".

Everything I do is with style – whether styling woman’s hair or styling gentlemen in the clothes that they wear.  It's why I started and take the lead in curating The Styled Man Box. It’s a company I started in July 2015 that sends out monthly boxes to male subscribers.  The boxes are filled with 4-6 men’s fashion accessories such as ties, pocket squares, lapel pins, socks, and more. In fact, many of the lapel pins and men's bracelets are designed and created by me.

Check out an example of what might be in The Styled Man Box here:

I've also written a couple of e-books. One, in particular, that gives men seven ways to instantly improve their fashion style.

So, expanding the reach of The Styled Man Box is so important to me because I know that there are so many men out there that are frustrated, unsure and even nervous about putting accessories together that go along with their suits or outfits. They can simply take the accessories out of their monthly box and combine it with their black, blue or grey suit and be absolutely and completely ready to challenge the world while looking great.

I'm looking to raise $6,000. Your contributions will help to procure a PR Specialist, purchase better boxes and supplies, as well as more marketing and advertising so that we can help out more men across the U.S. and around the world up-grade their personal style.

Check out how we package and mail our boxes here:

The perks and benefits of contributing to The Styled Man Box are that you will help more desperately style-challenged men find out about an effortless and affordable way to become more stylishly presentable and make the world a more fashionable place.

If you are not able to contribute, we ask that you help spread the word and make some noise about this campaign on social media.  You can even use the Indiegogo share tools!

I thank you for your time in reading through this campaign and I will be forever grateful for your contribution(s).

Sincerely,

Lance McBrayer

story:
Zur deutschen Version bitte nach unten scrollen.

-

The limited jubilee edition -


redesign of successfully watch from the 90s.


25 years after the first prototype Alexander Burhans, watch designer from Freiburg in Germany, decided to revise the watch after a complete redesign.

The new men's model is now much larger, the case line even more finely and the dial color brighter and friendlier. And as a very special touch of color, the anniversary watch wearing a red date point.


-


Ladies first..

And this time there is at the beginning a smaller version for the ladies.

Both versions appear as limited edition - and each watch then bear its own personal serial number. 

0001 / 1992 …………….. 1992 / 1992

Worldwide only 1992 timepieces each !


-


The idea

The date at wristwatches's often very small and for many not always easy to read. But, by the idea to display the day of a month as a dot that rotates around the circumference of the whole size of movement becomes to the face of the watch.

- 


The history 

This watch, named at the time the “Orbit” – due to it’s unusual way of displaying the date – also found it’s way in the late 90s into the US market. Well-known design and museum shops such as the Museum of Contemporary Art Chicago, the San Francisco Museum of Modern Art and MoMA (Museum of Modern Art) in New York took on this watch.

But considering today's watches, the former model was a relatively small men's wristwatch (only ø 36 mm).


-


New production in 2016

The new models will bear my name. And so they will made made accordingly to my own high quality standards. Only the best materials are used!

Cases - stainless steel (L 316), wateresistant 5 ATM. 50 m ( 165 ft.)

Size - Man ø 39,5 mm, Lady ø 32 mm

Hight - Man 6,7 mm, Lady 6,5 mm

Crystals - scratch-resistant sapphire crystals

Movements - Swiss movements, Ronda RQ 715/ RQ 784

Straps - high quality leather straps (Calf/Nubuk) black or dark brown with stainless steel buckle.

Warranty - 2 years


-


The App

Get the watch face on your smartphone!

Enjoy the unusual way of displaying the date on your smartphone. All backers will receive this wunderful App ( iOS or Android ) in November 2016. With the App (full function) you may design your own colorful watch face. 


- 


Black is beautiful.. !

You prefer dark colors? No problem: here are the black unlimited  Men and Ladies !

If you like to get this wonderful model with black face we will deliver your watch at same time.


-


Deutsch


-

Limitierte Jubiläumsedition -


Redesign einer erfolgreichen Uhr aus den 90ern.


25 Jahre nach dem ersten Prototyp hat Alexander Burhans, Uhrendesigner aus Freibug beschlossen, die Uhr von Grund auf neu zu überarbeiten und nach einem kompletten Redesign, neu zu produzieren.

Das neue Herrenmodell ist jetzt deutlich größer, das Gehäuse noch feiner und die Zifferblattfarbe heller und freundlicher. Und als ganz besonderen Farbtupfer, trägt die Jubiläumsuhr einen roten Datumspunkt. 


-


Ladies first..

Und diesmal gibt es gleich zu Beginn auch eine kleinere Version für die Damen.

Beide Versionen erscheinen als limited Edition - und jede einzelne Uhr trägt dann ihre eigene, persönliche Seriennummer.  

0001 / 1992 …………….. 1992 / 1992

Weitweit gibt es dann jeweils nur 1992 Exemplare !


-


Die Idee

Die Datumsanzeige bei Armbanduhren ist ja oft sehr klein und für viele nicht immer gut ablesbar. Aber, durch die Idee das Datum als laufenden Punkt anzuzeigen und damit die gesamte Lauffläche des Uhrwerks auszunutzen, wurde diese Anzeige - quasi - zum Gesicht der Uhr.

- 


Die Geschichte

Das Modell L 01 entwickelte sich sehr schnell zu einem Besteller und fand in Europa, vor allem in Deutschland, der Schweiz, Belgien, Holland und Norwegen viele Freunde, ebenso in Japan. Als Modell Orbit fand diese Uhr mit der außergewöhnlichen Datumsanzeige, Ende der 90er Jahre, auch den Weg in die USA. Und dort in die Verkaufs-Kollektion namhafter Design- und Museumshops, wie z.B. Museum of Contemporary Art Chicago, San Francisco Museum of Modern Art und dem MoMA (Museum of Modern Art ) in New York.

Aber gemessen an den heutigen Uhren, war das damalige Modell  eine relativ kleine Herren-Armbanduhr (nur ø 36 mm).


-


Neuproduktion in 2016

Die neuen Modelle werden meinen Namen tragen.  Und darum werden sie auch nach meinen eigenen, hohen Qualitätsansprüchen angefertigt. Nur die besten Materialien kommen zum Einsatz!

Gehäuse - Edelstahl (L 316), wasserdicht bis 5 ATM. 50 Meter

Größe - Herren ø 39,5 mm, Damen ø 32 mm

Höhe - Herren 6,7 mm, Damen 6,5 mm

Gläser - kratzfeste Sahirgläser

Werke - Schweizer Uhrwerke Ronda RQ 715/ RQ 784

Armbänder - Kalbsleder mit weicher Nubukleder-Innenseite, in schwarz oder dunkelbraun

Garantie - 2 Jahre


-


Die App

Lade Dir "das Gesicht der Uhr" auf Dein Smartphone!

Erlebe die ungewöhnliche Datumsanzeige auf Deinem Display. Alle Unterstützer erhalten diese schöne App (für iOS oder Android ) -kostenlos- im November 2016. Mit der App "multi function" könnt Ihr farbtechnisch Eure persönliche Uhr designen.


- 


Black is beautiful.. !

Du magst lieber Schwarz? Kein Problem: hier sind die "black unlimiteds" für Damen und Herren!

Wenn Du diese schöne Uhr lieber in schwarz trägst, werden wir Dir Dein persönliches Lieblingsmodell zur gleichen Zeit liefern.




Risiken und Herausforderungen

We got many years of experience in watchmaking and will do our best to deliver the watches on time and in the promised quality. We work with serveral suppliers for cases, hands, movements, dials, straps, etc. and of course that can cause delays. But we're sure the watches will be already finished latest in January 2017.
We want to keep the the production very transparently and will give our backers regular updates about progress in manufacturing.

Deutsch
Wir verfügen über langjährige Erfahrung in der Uhrenherstellung und werden unser Bestes dafür tun, um die Uhren in der versprochenen Qualität pünktlich fertigzustellen. Da wir mit verschiedenen Zulieferern für Gehäuse, Zeiger, Werke, Zifferblätter, Armbänder, etc. arbeiten, kann es natürlich immer mal zu zeitlichen Verzögerungen kommen. Trotzdem sind wir uns sicher, dass alle Uhren spätestens im Januar 2017 lieferbereit sind.
Um die Produktion und die Abläufe möglichst transparent zu halten, werden wir unsere Unterstützer regelmäßig über den Stand der Produktion informieren.

vor allem in Deutschland, der Schweiz, Belgien, Holland und Norwegen 
viele Freunde, ebenso in Japan. Als Modell Orbit fand diese Uhr mit der 
außergewöhnlichen Datumsanzeige, Ende der 90er Jahre, auch den Weg in 
die USA. Und dort in die Verkaufs-Kollektion namhafter Design- und 
Museumshops, wie z.B. Museum of Contemporary Art Chicago, San Francisco 
Museum of Modern Art und dem MoMA (Museum of Modern Art ) in New York.
Aber gemessen an den heutigen Uhren, war das damalige Modell  eine relativ kleine Herren-Armbanduhr (nur ø 36 mm). 

-

Neuproduktion in 2016
Die
 neuen Modelle werden meinen Namen tragen.  Und darum werden sie auch 
nach meinen eigenen, hohen Qualitätsansprüchen angefertigt. Nur die 
besten Materialien kommen zum Einsatz! 
Gehäuse - Edelstahl (L 316), wasserdicht bis 5 ATM. 50 Meter 
Größe - Herren ø 39,5 mm, Damen ø 32 mm 
Höhe - Herren 6,7 mm, Damen 6,5 mm
Gläser - kratzfeste Sahirgläser 
Werke - Schweizer Uhrwerke Ronda RQ 715/ RQ 784 
Armbänder - Kalbsleder mit weicher Nubukleder-Innenseite, in schwarz oder dunkelbraun 
Garantie - 2 Jahre

-

Die App
Lade Dir "das Gesicht der Uhr" auf Dein Smartphone!


Erlebe
 die ungewöhnliche Datumsanzeige auf Deinem Display. Alle Unterstützer 
erhalten diese schöne App (für iOS oder Android ) -kostenlos- im November 2016. Mit der App "multi function" könnt Ihr 
farbtechnisch Eure persönliche Uhr designen.

- 

Black is beautiful.. !
Du magst lieber Schwarz? Kein Problem: hier sind die "black unlimiteds" für Damen und Herren!






black unlimited


Wenn Du diese schöne Uhr lieber in schwarz trägst, werden wir Dir Dein persönliches Lieblingsmodell zur gleichen Zeit liefern. 



Risiken und Herausforderungen
We got many years of experience in watchmaking and will do our best 
to deliver the watches on time and in the promised quality. We work with
 serveral suppliers for cases, hands, movements, dials, straps, etc. and
 of course that can cause delays. But we're sure the watches will be 
already finished latest in January 2017.
We want to keep the the production very transparently and will give our backers regular updates about progress in manufacturing.
Deutsch
Wir verfügen über langjährige Erfahrung in der Uhrenherstellung und 
werden unser Bestes dafür tun, um die Uhren in der versprochenen 
Qualität pünktlich fertigzustellen. Da wir mit verschiedenen Zulieferern
 für Gehäuse, Zeiger, Werke, Zifferblätter, Armbänder, etc. arbeiten, 
kann es natürlich immer mal zu zeitlichen Verzögerungen kommen. Trotzdem
 sind wir uns sicher, dass alle Uhren spätestens im Januar 2017 
lieferbereit sind.
Um die Produktion und die Abläufe möglichst transparent zu halten, 
werden wir unsere Unterstützer regelmäßig über den Stand der Produktion 
informieren.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
DESIGN 

We believe great watch designs should be preserved. Many of the famous luxury timepieces are only access by few. We strive to make it available to common people like you and me who love nice looking watches without the need to break our bank. We have been working with designers and watch makers to develop multiple prototypes and keep on perfecting our final designs.  

 

WATCH SPECIFICATION

Manufacturer: Advisor Watch Co.
Model no: Founder Edmon Series
Strap: Genuine Premium Thick Leather (black or dark brown)
Case Tone: Silver, Bronze, Rose-Gold
Movement: Japanese Miyota Quartz 
Dial: Black (dual layered)
Glass: Mineral Crystal Domed Shaped
Case material: Stainless steel + Alloy
Lume: Hour markers and hands
Water resistance: 3 ATM
Width of strap: 24 mm
Face size: 45 mm length x 50 mm width

DIRECTLY TO YOU

We do things differently.

By using a disruptive, direct-to-consumer model we cut out distributors, wholesalers and retails stores.

Available Stocks (Limited Pieces Left):
Bronze Tone - limited to 50 pieces produced globally
Rose-Gold Tone - limited to 50 pieces produced globally
Silver Tone - limited to 100 pieces produced globally

THE COLLECTION

SILVER CHROME:

BRONZE MATT:

ROSE-GOLD: (NOT AVAILABLE)

Genuine Premium Thick Leather:

LUME:

PHOTO GALLERY:

 

What We Need & What You Get

We have already gone into production of the watches (Founders Series - Limited to 200 pieces). Every purchase of Advisor watch comes with a nicely packed box. We are only releasing 50-80 pieces on Indiegogo. Grab yours immediately as we will not produce the same model again. 

With your support, it will allow us to work on our next model with improved quality in every aspect. Thank you. 

Warranty

We provide a 1 year warranty for all Indiegogo supporters. Warranty covers only the watch movement. 

Follow Us on Facebook

https://www.facebook.com/advisorwatches/

Risks & Challenges

  • Your risks are kept to the lowest as we had prototype the watches, went into production of the first batch of founder series. We are seeking support to continue expanding our ranges and to include new design for the second project.
